Благодаря упорному труду Кулумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kulumkan is 61 years old, a widow, and has raised six children alone. Five of the children are married and live separately and independently. Kulumkan's youngest son lives with her, he is a second year student. Kulumkan has secondary education. Her main income is livestock breeding, which she started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulumkan's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow and 11 sheep. The monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulumkan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock. Kulumkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJEKAFO  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26ans, 1enfant et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARAKO, une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
Mme AWA  (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de mil. Elle vend quotidiennement à FARAKO et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group DJEKAFO are married women, who average 26 years of age and one child each, all living in polygamous families FAKOLA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at any moment. They are on their first loan with the institution. 

Ms. AWA (first at the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of corn and 3 sacks of millet. She makes her sales each day in FAKOLA and is much in demand, especially on market days. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Gladys Viviana

texts.es:
Gladys Viviana tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y esposo en el distrito de Zaña, situada cerca al valle del Río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tienen una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y productos de belleza, cuanta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos como cremas de belleza, cosméticos, perfumes, entre otros para tener en stock para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Viviana is 45-years old. She lives with her son and husband in the Zaña District. The area is situated near the Río Jequetepeque valley. Living in this area has allowed Gladys to develop herself through agriculture. The people there make their livings as shop keepers and raising livestock. The area is located in Chiclayo Provence, which is a part of the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Perú.

Gladys has a small general store where she sells basic household items and beauty products. She has a considerable clientele. Gladys has requested a loan of 2 000 nuevos soles (USD $725) to purchase beauty products such as beauty creams, cosmetics, perfumes and other items that she wants to have in stock for her customers. This way, she will be able to generate a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics to stock up her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking season for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is married with four children; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister-in-law's daughters). 

She has a business selling onions, and has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income from washing people’s clothes. She works in the market seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis only.  Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves.

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of onions. 

Allen aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to educate her children up to university. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of emergency loans and school fees. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Kadiatu runs a fish business; she sells fish within a busy market area. She has been running this business for seven years. She works at the business from throughout the week and 12 hours per day. Kadiatu says that at present her business is doing well.

Kadiatu has requested a loan to purchase more fish to expand her business. 

The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business

loans.name: Bomporo

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Bomporo from Waterloo, Western Area Rural District in Freetown. She is married with six children. Bomporo established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business from 9:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge of her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Bomporo requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil and soap to prepare her local soap business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Bomporo plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and soap to prepare her local soap business.

loans.name: Dini

texts.en:
Dini is a housewife living in Bandung, a major city of West Java located about 2-3 hours from Jakarta. She runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credit. Dini's husband works in a local police department. 

Dini learned about Ruma from Ruma agents who came by her stall, and she was interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to improve her business. Currently, she is taking a working capital loan from Kiva to generate more sales especially on weekends. As her business continues, she has had average sales of $11-12 per day just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. In the long term, Dini is planning to add more items to her stall and put aside the extra income to support her son's education. In the photo, Dini is standing in front of her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: galvanised metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof and put a cement floor in a room of her home

loans.name: Patricia Yaneth

texts.es: Patricia de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 2 años de edad y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Patricia se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace mucho tiempo. EL negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar de residencia y cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el mismo. Desea invertir en su negocio ya que en esta época las ventas aumentan y desea contar con los materiales necesarios para elaborar las prendas de vestir que le soliciten. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: variedad de telas, hilos, elástico, agujas, etc.
texts.en:
Patricia, 37, lives in her own house with her 2-year-old daughter and 9-year-old son. Her children are the most important thing to her and that is why she does all she can to provide them with better living conditions. 

Patricia has been making and selling articles of clothing for a long time. Her business is located in her house and she has 6 years of experience. She wants to invest in her business since at this time sales are increasing and she wants to have the necessary materials to make the clothing that her customers request. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of materials needed such as a variety of fabrics, thread, elastic, needles etc...

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics, thread, elastic, needles etc...

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 48 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 18 años, 19 años y 22 años de edad. Para Blanca sus hijos lo son todo y es por ellos que trabaja duramente para sacarlos adelante. Blanca se dedica a la venta de fruta preparada en  bolsa la cual vende de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad.  Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta (sandía, naranjas, piña, guineos, etc.), para tener una mayor oferta y así aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 48, lives in her own house with her children ages 18, 19 and 22. For Blanca her children are everything and that is why she works hard to get ahead. Blanca is a street vendor who sells ready-to-eat fruits in bags in the main areas in her city.  

In order to improve her living conditions she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest it in the purchase of a large quantity of fruits (watermelon, oranges, pineapples, bananas etc...) to have increased supply and therefore increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, oranges, pineapples, bananas etc...

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is 37 years old. She lives in a small village with her husband and 3 children. She requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 10 years. Her husband helps her with managing business. She sells her cattle in local market.

She wants to develop her business but she does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase her number of cattle and from her profits, improve her living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets and wood to be able to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Irlis Yamileth

texts.es: Irlis de 23 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de almuerzos, refrescos y golosinas.  Tiene un año de experiencia en el negocio y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina ya que en la actualidad las láminas se encuentran deterioradas y no es muy seguro. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el cuarto de la cocina.
texts.en:
Irlis, 23, lives in her own house with her family.
She sells lunches, drinks and candies. She has one year of experience with the business and this is how she supports her household.
She wishes to repair her kitchen because right now the sheet metal is very damaged and it is not very safe. She asks FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of laminated sheet metal and wood to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is a 35-year-old lady from Kakamega county. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 18, and 9 respectively.

She operates a grocery business as she has done for the past 13 years with an income of KES 10,000 per month. This is her first loan with Vision fund Kenya. It’s a loan worth KES 10,000 which she intends to use in buying sacks of vegetables and fruits and other food stuffs. 

She will use the profits to repay her loan and expand the business. She has a dream of giving her children the best education.

loans.use: buy sacks of vegetables and fruits and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Farima

texts.en:
Fatima is a widowed woman who was born in 1968. She has been selling blankets for seven years and finds it a good source of income to cover her needs as she is living alone. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales as the winter is coming. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
Shaker is single, and he is a youth client from Iraq. He is 26 years old and lives with his family composed of 5 members, 2 of whom are employed.

Shaker owns a cosmetics shop. He has a wide selection of perfumes, shampoos, creams and beauty supplies. In 2011, Shaker established his business and since then he has been providing his income from the profits of this shop. Shaker has much experience in this field and is loved by his neighbors.

Shaker is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may add more items in his shop to sell and enhance his current financial conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 35 years old and a married woman. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law, in Khelvachauri. Natia's husband works at the road department, and her father-in-law works at a stone factory. They are paid monthly. Her mother-in-law trades in vegetables.

Natia has her own business. She gets orders and bakes cakes. She has satisfied customers. She needs additional equipment, to bake more cakes and thus increase the income she can earn. Natia decided to expand her business with a loan. Natia received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This is called the Start-up Program, and it gives rural poor people the chance to start or restart businesses.

With the loan of USD 1,200, she will purchase ingredients and equipment, such as an oven, for expanding her activities. Then she will serve more customers, with a wide assortment of products. Her regular customers will be local people, and passersby as well. Natia will serve her customers herself, and will work hard to increase turnover gradually. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an oven and raw materials, with which to bake cakes

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda is a married woman who was born in 1968. She is a mother of 6. Her husband is a teacher.  Three years ago, she decided to help her husband financially by selling blankets and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales as the winter is coming.  This will help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Iván es un hombre trabajador de 64 años de edad, dedicado a su labor de comerciante independiente desde hace 17 años, su negocio consiste en ofrecer insumos odontológicos y para laboratorio para diferentes consultorios de la ciudad, trabaja solo y aprendió de una manera empírica esta labor, así se ha ganado el dinero para sostener a dos hijos. Actualmente atraviesa por una dificultad económica debido al lento recaudo de su cartera, por lo que se apoya en el crédito para comprar más surtido al por mayor (instrumentos odontológicos y de laboratorio), así podrá capitalizar su negocio y podrá hacerle frente a las dificultades económicas.
Iván trabaja arduamente cada día con empeño, esfuerzo y mucha perseverancia, pues sueña con ser un gran empresario y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iván is a hard-working 64-year-old.  He has been a dedicated independent trader for 17 years.  His business consists of selling dental and laboratory supplies for the different clinics in the city.  He works alone and has learnt his trade by experience, earning the money he needs to support his two children.  At the moment, he is going through a hard time economically because his clients are slow paying their accounts.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan to be able to buy more supplies wholesale (dental and laboratory equipment), which will allow him to develop his business and solve his financial problems.

Iván works very hard every day with determination, effort and a lot of perseverance because he dreams of being a successful businessman and increasing his sales and income to be able to offer his children a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale supplies (dental and laboratory equipment).

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

John is married and has thirteen children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirteen years now and they are currently growing maize, cassava, sunflower and watermelon on their farm. His wife runs a small business. John is excited about beekeeping as it is easy to manage, it requires little land space and it is a good source of income.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care as it gives him an opportunity to acquire beehives for a loan. He plans to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay school fees for his children and to invest more in beekeeping. John’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project for more income generation.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se caracteriza por los grandes depósitos de arena y ripio que se utiliza para las construcciones de viviendas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles, para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 25-years old. He lives in the Cayaltí District. The community is characterized by great deposits of sand and stone, which are used in building the houses. The people in the area make their livings as shop keepers and raising livestock. The area is located an hour and 20 minutes from Chiclayo, on the northern cost of Perú.

Jonathan offers public transportation services with his own "mototaxi." He brings his passengers to the outlying neighborhoods of his district. He has requested a loan of 3 000 nuevos soles (USD $1075) to provide maintenance for his vehicle. He will then be able to continue offering his services, which will allow him to generate a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes, bags and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes, such as blouses, t-shirts, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and flour, so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a  married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Florenda runs a motorcycle business with her husband and has had this business for 20 years now.  This is the source of their income.

Florenda is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle, such as tires, chains, nuts and bolts and fuel. With this, they will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the tricycle.

In the future, Florenda hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle like tires, chains, nuts and bolts and fuel

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena lives in Gavar city which is  in the Gegharkunik region. She is not married and she lives with her brother’s family. 

She is engaged in the clothes trading business at the Gavar city wholesale market. She sells a great variety of clothes; she sells men's and women's clothes, shoes, and slippers; women's underwear; children's and babies' clothes and shoes; and towels and covers for children. She also sells shampoos in her stall. 

All these products she brings from Yerevan wholesale markets in a rented car. As she says she has become very skilled in this field and the income of her business is rather good.

She asks a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to renew her stall’s assortment since with the coming of Christmas and New Year’s holidays she expects to have good sales.

loans.use: to renew her stall’s assortment since with the coming of Christmas and New Year’s holidays she expects to have good sales

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 28 years old. She is married with three children, only one of whom goes to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil and peanuts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to investment and save more. Chantal was very happy with her previous loan, and she made all of her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es: La señora Irma Leticia es madre de 4 hijos los cuales ya son adolecentes y algunos mayores de edad y ya casados ella es una mujer emprendedora la cual se preocupa por sacar adelante a sus hijos ella aporta con los ongresos de su negoció para el sustento de su familia, tiene sueños y metas muy grandes de poder sacar adelante a su familia…..anteriormente ella solicito un crédito para la inversión de animales como por ejemplo gallinas, cerdos, y pavos los cuales ella vendió en época navideña actualmente sigue criando animales por lo que ella toca nuevamente las puertas de KIVA para la inversión en animales de granja(pollos pavos) para que su negocio siga creciendo y asi mismo ella siga llevando a cabo los sueños y metas que ella tiene…..ya que por estas fechas ella aprovecha para poder invertir en pavos y gallinas ella ya cancelo el crédito anterior con responsabilidad honestidad y espera que se le otorgue este nuevo crédito y con la ayuda de DIOS poder culminarlo y cancelarlo de la misma manera.
texts.en:
Irma Leticia is the mother of four children who are now either teenagers or adults who are already married.  She is an entrepreneurial woman which is why she is always concerned about helping her children get along.  She uses the income from her business to contribute to the family expenses.  She has big dreams and goals for helping her family.

Once before, she asked for a loan to help her invest in animals such as hens, pigs and turkeys which she sold during the Christmas period.  Now, she is still raising animals, which is why she is turning to Kiva once again to help her invest in farm animals (chickens and turkeys) so that her business can continue to grow.  In this way, she can carry on fulfilling her dreams and objectives, especially as she takes advantage of this time of year to invest in turkeys and hens, 

She already paid off the previous loan in a responsible and honest way.  She hopes that she will be granted this new loan and that with God’s help, will be able to use it to the same advantage and pay it off in the same way.

loans.use: to buy animals (chickens and turkeys) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slipper, meat, and cool water for her business.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  no estudio solo se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos,  es casada; el esposo ya es jubilado, sus tres hijos están casados  con hogares apartes y viven en otras comunidades.

María, vende verduras y frutas este negocio lo hace desde hace dos años, lo aprendió sola, viendo la necesidad de  vender fruta y verduras casa por casa este trabajo lo hace sola por las tardes, cuando la hora está fresca; ella por las tardes toma su canasta con verduras y sale por todo el cantón a vender.

El préstamo que está solicitando a fundación campo, es para comprar frutas y verduras como chile, guineos, zanahorias, papas, güisquiles, todo lo necesario que se ocupa para que las familias lo disfruten lo que ella vende en la zona. Hace dos meses solicito un préstamo y vio las ganancias que le genero el comprar más mercadería y es así como le ha  ido  mejorando.

Su  sueño es tener muchos clientes y que me puedan llegar a comprar a la casa, cuando ella ya no pueda salir a vender de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old.  She did not attend school but has been doing domestic work.  She is married; her husband is retired and her three children are married and have separate homes in other communities.  Maria sells fruits and vegetables and has done so for two years.  She learned to do this on her own and she saw the need to sell door to door in the evenings when the products are fresh.  She takes her basket in the evenings and goes around the community to sell.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as peppers, bananas, carrots, potatoes, and güisquiles; everything she needs so that the families will enjoy what she sells.  She asked for a loan two months ago and saw the earnings it generated by buying merchandise and this is how she has been improving her business.

Her dream is to have more customers who can come and buy from her home when she is not able to go out to sell on foot.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Because Suha is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Suha is a married woman who was born in 1971 and is living at a sector in Jordan called Irbid. She is a mother of seven. One of her sons works as a driver, and she has a retired husband. 

Suha has been running her mini market for five years. She started her project selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. Then she decided to expand it by opening her own independent mini market. 

Now she wants to supply her mini market with a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and income in order to cover her children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To supply her mini market with food products

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 42, is a married man who has six children. His children are 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, and 22 years old. They live in a rural area.
 
John is a farmer of matooke (banana) and onions. He also trades cattle to earn supplementary income. 

John has been a farmer since 1993. He started his farming business because he grew up helping his parents in the gardens and knew how to be a profitable farmer. His clients are fellow businessmen from his village. His dream is to be the leading supplier of agricultural products in his area.

John is requesting a loan to boost his agriculture business by buying soil fertilizer and pesticides. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He urges lenders to continue helping people for the purpose of developing their communities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Oyatullo

texts.ru:
Этого мужественного человека зовут Оятулло. Ему 34 года. Он глава семейства, любящий муж и ответственный отец. Оятулло отец двоих детей. У него девятилетняя девочка и семилетний мальчик. Он очень любит свою семью. Оятулло вместе с семьей проживают в городе Душанбе. Душанбе-столица Республики Таджикистана. Этот город по-своему красив и не повторим. Оятулло тоже любит свой город и ему нравиться проезжать по проспектам родного города. 
  Оятулло несколько лет назад работал таксистом. Доставлял своих клиентов из одной точки города до другой. По обстоятельствам, он продал свою машину и больше не предоставлял услуги таксиста. Но теперь у него есть возможность с помощью кредита снова вернуться в свою любимую работу. Оятулло планирует  собрать сбережения и сумму от кредита и купить машину.
texts.en:
This courageous man's name is Oyatullo. He is 34. He is the head of a family, a loving husband, and a responsible father. Oyatullo is a father of two. He has a nine year old girl and a boy of seven. He loves his family. Oyatullo lives with his family in Dushanbe. Dushanbe is the capital of the Republic of Tajikistan. The city is unique and beautiful in its own way. Oyatullo loves his city, and he likes to drive through the streets of his hometown. 

A few years ago, Oyatullo worked as a taxi driver. He drove his customers from one point to another in the city. Because of his circumstances, he had to sell his car, and so he no longer works as a taxi driver. Now he has the option of taking out a loan so that he can once again do his favorite work. Oyatullo plans to save money and take out a loan to buy a car.

loans.use: buy a taxi.

loans.name: Parida

texts.ru: Эту трудолюбивую, усердную и деятельную женщину зовут Парида. Ей 55 лет. Она живет в районе Спитамен со своим мужем, сыном, невесткой и маленькими внуками. Парида вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. Вот уже 8 лет как они разводят  крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Ей в этой деятельности нравится то, что она не только получает доход, но и обеспечивает свою семью молоком и молочными продуктами, которые очень необходимы ее маленьким внукам. В данный момент в скотном дворе осталось считанное количество скота. Парида и  ее муж хотят увеличить поголовье скота и дальше развивать свой бизнес. С такой целью они запрашивают кредит. На сумму кредита Парида собирается купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Этот кредит сейчас им очень нужен.
texts.en: This hard-working, diligent and active woman's name is Parida. She is 55 years old. She lives in Spitamen with her husband, son, daughter, and young grandchildren. Parida and her husband keep livestock. For eight years they have bred cattle for sale. What she likes most about this is the fact that it not only makes money, but it also provides her family with milk and dairy products, which her young grandchildren need very much. Currently they have a few cattle in their barnyard. Parida and her husband want to increase their livestock and further develop their business. Therefore, they are asking for a loan. Parida is going to use the loan to buy several head of cattle for fattening and resale. They really need this loan now.

loans.use: buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 3 y 12 años, en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la siembra. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.
El sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos y comprar una terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y la competencia. Le gusta ser responsable en el trabajo y salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Juan is 51-years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their children, who are 3 and 12-years old respectively, in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province.

Juan is a member of the communal bank "San Fransisco."  The communal bank is located in Pantano Precinct, which is a part of Ventanas Canton.  The members make their livings in agricultural work and ranching. 

Juan makes his living in agriculture; he plants corn.  He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, urea and fertilizers.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase what he needs for planting.  Juan will make his purchases in Ventanas.

Juan's dream is to give his children an education and to purchase some land.  The challenges that he faces are infestations and competition.  Juan likes to be responsible in his work, and he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for planting corn.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 39-летняя жительница района Варзоб. Она разведена и живет со своим ребенком у брата. Гулбахор работает швеей в одной фирме. Ее стаж работы составляет более 4 лет. Она умелая мастерица. Гулбахор решила теперь заняться этим делом у себя дома. Она хочет купить себе новую швейную машинку, но ее собственного сбережения не хватает для осуществления этой цели. В связи с этим она обратилась за кредитом. Гулбахор старается ради своего ребенка. Она хочет обеспечить ему светлое будущее.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a 39-year-old resident of Barzov. She is divorced and she and her baby live with her brother. Gulbahor works as a seamstress for a company. She has more than four years of work experience. She is a skilled craftswoman. Gulbahor has decided to start working from home. She wants to buy a new sewing machine, but she does not have enough savings. Hence she applied for a loan. Gulbahor wants to do this for her child's sake. She wants to give him a bright future.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is married and has seven children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a retail store, which she has had for eight years. The store is her income source. Mercedes is asking for a loan to buy six sacks of rice, two sacks of corn, and two cartons of canned goods. This will enable her to improve her store thus attracting more customers. In the future, Mercedes hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of rice, two sacks of corn, and two cartons of canned goods.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a married client from Iraq. He is 30 years old and has no children. Nabil is his family's sole provider. Nabil owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2012 and gained his experience by taking hair-cutting courses at an institute. Nabil is rapidly gaining fame and respect in his neighborhood thanks to the new hair-cutting methods he uses. Nabil is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to renovate his barber shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can take better care of both his family.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel and to pay for the installation of drinking water.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco runs a rice processing facility. He works with nearly 1,000 farmers in Rwanda's Southern Province, providing them cash advances so that they can grow the rice, which he buys back from them, processes, and sells to schools, hospitals, restaurants, and hotels all over Rwanda. 

Currently, the farmers that Jean Bosco works with grow short-grain rice, the cheapest variety used primarily for animal feed, as well as for low-cost bulk purchases in rural schools.

Jean Bosco, a 35-year-old father and business man, is looking for a Kiva loan so that he can process a new kind of rice, the long-grain variety primarily used in restaurants and hotels in Kigali. This higher priced product would bring more money to the farmers, and it would allow Jean Bosco to expand his business and hire additional employees in processing and distribution.

Currently Jean Bosco's rice processing business has the capacity to process twice as much rice. With this working capital loan, Jean Bosco can work with more farmers during the January harvest period, increase the rice processing at his facility, and hire more technicians and distributors. 

Jean Bosco hopes that over the next year, his factory will become the largest rice processor in Southern Rwanda, employing almost 100 permanent staff, and working with more than 2,000 farmers throughout the region. This loan will be enable him to get one step closer to that goal.

loans.use: To work with 10 farming cooperatives to process long-grain rice during the January harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trousers, jeans, blouses and used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Fredrick is married and has two children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 13 years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, beans, tomatoes, kale, sunflower, and watermelon on their farm. Fredrick is interested in beekeeping because it is easy to manage and it gives a different taste to farming.

This is Fredrick’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because of the opportunity it offers in providing beehives on loan, which is very encouraging. He plans to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay for school fees for his children and to provide for basic needs. Fredrick’s hope for the future is to invest in more hives for beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María Dominga tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el caserío las Juntas una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a vender ganado vacuno, lo compran en los caseríos aledaños, para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a sus clientes en la plaza de ganado de su distrito, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de toretes para ofrecerlo a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Dominga is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in Las Juntas village, a rural area in the Querocotillo district. Two hours north of the city of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands, the area is filled with green landscapes and the people work in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Alongside her husband, María works in cattle raising. She buys her cattle in neighbouring villages, fattens them up and then sells them to her customers at the local square. María has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy young bulls to sell at a better price. María will then earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy young bulls to sell at a better price.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.ru: Бунёду 23 года. Он с семьей проживает на районе Шахритус. Бунёд занимается земледелием. На своей земле выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Бунёд хочет начать другой бизнес - животноводства. Но чтобы начать такую деятельность у Бунёда не хватает нужной суммы денег для купли бычков. Бунёд хочет взять кредит и приобрести маленьких бычков из местного рынка и после 30-35 дней откорма перепродать их на том же рынке, где и купил. Таким не хитрым способом он собирается зарабатывать. И чтобы начать данный бизнес он просит Вашей помощи.
texts.en: Bunyod is 23. He and his family live in Shahrituz. Bunyod farms. He grows crops on his own land. Bunyod wants to start another business: raising livestock. However, Bunyod doesn't have enough money to buy calves. Bunyod wants to take out a loan to buy small calves from the local market. Then,  after 30-35 days of fattening he will resell them in the same market where he bought them. He is going to use this straightforward way to earn money. He is asking for your help to start this business.

loans.use: buy calves to start a livestock business.

loans.name: Rogger Hector

texts.es:
Rogger Héctor tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad ubicada sobre el valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rogger Héctor is 46 years old and lives with his wife in the Cayaltí district, a community to be found in the Zaña valley, an hour and twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast. Here the people work in farming, business and cattle raising.

Rogger makes a living offering public transport services with his motorcycle taxi. He takes passengers to the neighbouring villeges. Rogger has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to maintain his vehicle and to continue offer his taxi services and earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Adham

texts.ru: Адхам житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Адхам кормит семью благодаря своей машине. Адхам обычный водитель. Он занимается предоставлением услуги по перевозке пассажиров. Адхам работает водителем более 4 лет. В данный момент его машина имеет технические неполадки, из-за которых Адхам не может продолжить свою деятельность. В связи с этим Адхам обратился за кредитом. Он хочет купить запасные части для своей машины, чтобы отремонтировать его. Адхаму этот кредит очень важен, так как сейчас он остался без работы, а его семья без источника дохода.
texts.en: Adham is from Tursun-Zoda. He is 42 years old. He is married and has four children. Adham is able to feed the family because of his driving. Adham is a driver. He is transports passengers. Adham has been a driver for more than four years. Currently, his car has mechanical problems which have halted Adham's work. Therefore Adham applied for a loan. He wants to buy parts to repair his car. This loan is very important to Adham because he has lost his job and his family has no income.

loans.use: buy parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 64-year-old widowed mother of two children whose needs she has provided for since her husband passed away. In 2005, Fatima started her own business, a bakery specializing in special Lebanese traditional bread. It is her sole income source. 

Fatima, a hard worker with an excellent reputation among the customers and people in her region, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special flour, oil and many other raw materials that will develop her business and increase her income, especially during the upcoming Christmas and winter season.

Fatima hopes to stay in good health to keep earning a living and supporting her children.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special flour, oil and many other raw materials that will develop her business and increase her income, especially during the upcoming Christmas and winter season

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a farmer who lives in the Eldoret area of North Rift, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are school age. She loves farming; it is her main source of income. Esther has practiced mixed farming for eight years and she produces and sells milk and eggs. Her major challenge in farming is during dry spells when she doesn't get enough fodder to feed her cows. She chose Juhudi Kilimo because their loans have insurance coverage for purchased assets; if one's cow dies because of sickness the farmer is fully compensated. This loan will help Esther provide a good education for her children and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: For poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cow skin and fufu for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, está soltero, sin hijos, vive en casa propia, vive con sus hermanos, estudio hasta quinto grado de básica.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra sandilleria, milpas, se dedica a esto desde que tiene 14 años de edad.  Toda su vida trabajo en la tierra y todos sus créditos han sido destino al mismo trabajo, que significa que lo invierte en comprar abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas.

Planea que su familia, hermanos, primos puedan trabajar duro, para que sus hijos tengan beneficios para estudiar ya que él no tiene hijos y trabaja para poder ayudarle a su familia, en patrimonio donde puedan seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old, single and has no children. He lives in a house that he owns with his siblings. José completed up to fifth grade of school.

José makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and other crops. He has been doing this work since he was 14 years old. He has worked all his life in farming and all of his loans have gone to this same work. José will invest this loan in manure, fertilisers and pesticids.

José wants his family, siblings and cousins, to work hard so that there children have the money to study. José does not have children and works in order to help his family. and leave them an inheritance so that they can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en: Theresie is 40 years old. She is married with two children, who are five and eleven and both in school. Theresie has requested a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. She will use the profits from the business to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children. In 2012, Mariatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create income for her survival. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Mariatu requires a loan to purchase more drinks, soap, biscuits, and cigarettes for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, soap, biscuits, and cigarettes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough sugar, oil, flour, etc., to increase her sales.

loans.name: Lorpu P.

texts.en: Lorpu P. is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville North. She is a 6th grade dropout.  She is married and has four children. Her children are in school. Since 2000, she has been selling sugar, onions, and flour in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, onions, and bags of flour for her business. She started this business with a loan that she received from her mother. Her plan is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, onions, and bags of flour for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough children's t-shirts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Mujeres Unidas, está conformada por diez integrantes, madres solteras con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Walkiria y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación Mujeres Unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) consists of ten members; single mothers with children in their care. They are originally from the northern region of the country. They are noted for being responsible workers with a drive towards personal improvement. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources they could not attend university and had to start working from a young age. Today they fight to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her efforts and drive to get ahead, the coordinator Walkiria’s economic activity is a “pulpería.” A pulpería is a small store that sells food items in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juice and sodas. She spends 12 hours a day at her business offering her products. 
The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase and sale of food items so that in the not too far future she can earn a higher income. 

The association Mujeres Unidas is grateful for the help of Kiva investors that provide people of little resources and poor countries like Nicaragua a way to make a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of food items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and spices for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like sugar, beans, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo de 66 años de edad,  es padre de dos hijos de 7 y 16 años de edad, que estudian noveno y tercer grado de educación básica, el cliente estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica, vive con toda su familia, que la integran su esposa y sus hijos.

Él se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, toda su vida se dedicó a eso, es un trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, pues desde que era un niño, los ayudaba con ello y es la herramienta que da sustento a su familia.

El dinero que está solicitando,  lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de trabajo, como abonos, fertilizantes, vitaminas, medicamentos que utiliza para el ganado.

Planea seguir trabajando duro para brindarles a sus hijos el estudio y poder dejarle un patrimonio para que ellos sigan trabajando.
texts.en:
Pablo is 66 years old, and he is the father of two children, aged 7 and 16, who are studying in the third and ninth grades of primary school. He has studied up to the sixth grade.  He lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and his children. 

He has worked in agriculture and cattle raising all of his life—work that he learned from his parents, as he had helped them with it ever since he was a little boy—and it is the means by which he provides for his family. 

He will use the money that he is requesting to purchase materials for his work—compost, fertilizer, and vitamins and medicine that he will use for the livestock.  

He plans to keep working hard, in order to give his children an education, and to be able to leave an inheritance for them so that they may continue working.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work--compost and fertilizer, and vitamins and medicine that he will use for his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos desde hace mucho tiempo. María se dedica a la comercialización de hoja de banano (hoja utilizada para la elaboración de tamales: comida típica del país), de esta forma colabora con los gastos del hogar y junto a su esposo unen esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila para reguardar el agua. Con el monto comprará lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en: María, 49 years old, has lived in her own home with her spouse and kids for some time. Maria makes banana leaves (leaves used to make tamales, a regional dish). This is how she contributes to paying the household expenses. She and her husband work together to get ahead for their kids. She’s asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in the construction of a trough to hold water. With this money she will buy galvanized sheets, bricks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a trough.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is 30 years old. He is a youth client from Iraq who lives with his parents. He helps his parents in providing the family income. 

Mazen owns a barber shop. After working for several years as an employee at a barber shop, he gained enough experience to establish his own business, which he did in 2004. His dynamism and creativity have given him a good reputation. 

Mazen is requesting a youth loan of $1,800. This loan will be used to install an external ceiling for his barber shop. With this loan, Mazen is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits to improve his and his parents' current financial situations.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for his barber shop

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite its proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practised in the region, many individuals have expressed an interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Benard is married and has three children. He and his wife are farmers. His wife is a housewife. They have been farming for five years and are currently growing bananas, papaya, vegetables, maize and blue gum trees on their farm. Benard is looking forward to beekeeping, as he loves honey, and this is an opportunity for him to generate extra income.

This is Benard’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because the organization is offering him a loan that he can afford and because of its good relations with farmers. He plans to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay school fees for his children and to support the vulnerable in the community. His hope for the future is to generate enough income to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory of oil, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashionable children's clothing, rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jefferson Joel

texts.es:
Jefferson tiene 19 años de edad estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres, en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Jefferson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Mocahe.

El sueño terminar los estudios y ser un buen profesional. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y la competencia. Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jefferson is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas neighborhood in the Rios province.

He is a member of the San Francisco communal bank, which is located in the district of Pantano, which belongs to the Ventanas neighborhood. They work in agriculture and livestock. 

Jefferson works in agriculture, sowing corn. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the necessary materials for cultivating. He will make the purchases in Mocahe. 

He dreams of finishing his studies and being a good professional. The challenges that he encounters are pests and competition. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for sowing corn.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida desde hace mucho tiempo. Jorge se dedica al cultivo de la tierra y a la albañilería. Es un hombre muy trabajador quien es reconocido por sus vecinos y dan buenas referencias. Jorge desea mejorar algunas áreas de su vivienda  por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el encementado y para pintar las paredes. Con el monto que solicita comprará cemento, arena, grava y pintura. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio al encementado del piso y a pintar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Jorge, 31 years old, has lived in his own home with his partner for some time. Jorge works as a farmer and a mason. He’s a hard working man who’s well-known by his neighbors who give good references. Jorge would like to improve a couple of places in his house which is why he’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cementing and painting the walls. With the money he’s asking for, he’ll buy cement, sand, gravel, and paint. He hopes to get this loan and be able to begin cementing the floor and painting the walls of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and pinat to cement the floor and paint the walls of his home.

loans.name: Rosbella

texts.en:
Rosbella lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Rosbella is a widow with six children. She has been farming for 20 years now and is currently growing maize, beans and sunflowers. She is looking forward to beekeeping as it is a good source of income and she loves honey.

This is Rosbella’s first loan with Honey Care. She likes working with Honey Care as it has enabled her to access beehives which will help her to generate income. She intends to use the proceeds generated from beekeeping to pay for her children’s school fees and to cater for basic development.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 39-year-old lady from Shienwe, which is found in the Kakamega region within the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family and is married to Walter, who is a businessman from the same location. 

She has two children who are 13 and 8 years old, respectively. This is her first loan, which she will use to purchase more shop items, hence adding more stock value. 

The anticipated profit will be used to expand her business. Her hope and dream is to expand the business so as to educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock of shop items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jenny Edmy

texts.es: La señora Jenny tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijas, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Cochabamba, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera técnica en corte y confección por ello se dedica a eso, enfocandose en prendas de vestir para niños, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina e insumos básicos (tela, hilos) para confección, ya que quiere incrementar su trabajo y por consiguiente sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jenny is 41 years old. She’s married and has two children. She lives in a house with her parents in the city of Cochabamba. She’s studying for a technical career in dressmaking since she’s working on that field making children’s clothes. Right now she’s asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and basic supplies (fabric, thread) to make clothes since she wants to work more and then, with her income, improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and basic supplies (fabric, thread) to make clothes.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer was born in 1981. She is married and has four children and lives in a section of Jordan called Southern Ghour. 

Abeer has been running her mini-market for five years. She started her business by selling a small quantity of food products and she found that profitable. Then she decided to expand her business by opening her own independent mini-market. 

Now she wants to stock her mini-market with a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and income to cover her children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini-market with food products

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба жительница города Истаравшан. Ее возраст 37 лет. Она мать двоих детей. У нее сын и дочка, которые учатся в школе. Муж Насибы водитель. Он работает по маршрутной линии города с раннего утра до вечера. Насиба тоже зарабатывает на жизнь. Она умелая мастерица. Насиба в течение 6 лет занимается шитьем. Она принимает заказы дома и шьет в основном женские национальные платья разных фасонов. Насиба хочет расширить свое дело. Она умеет делать вышивку на платьях, но к сожалению у нее нет для этого необходимой машинки. В связи с этим Насиба обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить такую вышивальную машинку. Благодаря этой машинки она будет принимать заказы не только на шитьё, но и на вышивку, что поможет увеличить количество клиентов и естественно дохода.
texts.en: Nasiba is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 37 years old and the mother of two children, a son and a daughter who both go to school.  Nasiba's husband is a driver who works along a city line from early morning until the evening.  Nasiba also works to make a living.  She is a skilled craftswoman who has been involved in sewing for the past six years.  She takes orders at home and mostly sews different styles of women's traditional dresses.  She would like to expand her business.  She knows how to do embroidery on the dresses that she sews, but unfortunately she doesn't have an embroidery machine, and for this reason, she is taking a loan to be able to buy one.  An embroidery machine will allow her to take embroidery orders in addition to sewing orders, which will increase her number of customers and net income.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother, and all her children go to school. She has a retail shop business, and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and bars of soap.  

She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves, defaulters, and seasonality. 

She aspire to own a fully stocked shop, and also to become a wholesaler.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital  to expand her business. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cartons of salt, and bars of soap.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a repeat client of IMON. She was born in the year 1977. Sanavbar is married and has three children. Sanavbar has her own business. She has been busy with animal husbandry and growing crops and potatoes. She has her own sowing land. Sanavbar feeds cattle by her house, where she has a cowshed. Sanavbar wants to do a sowing, but does not have money. She is asking for a loan of 13,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. 

This is her second loan from IMON, and she has a good credit history. This loan will help her to develop her business. From the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season

loans.name: Sirakan

texts.en:
Sirakan, age 24, is from the village of Satkha, and lives with his wife, infant child and parents. He is Armenian, but his family has lived in Georgia for years. Sirakhan works as a manufacturer at the local metal and plastic workshop and gets a monthly salary. His earnings are modest and hardly enough to cover food and household expenses.

In order to generate stable monthly funds, Sirakan plans to pay for a kiosk where he will start a small store. He will also buy stock of merchandise and various food products to sell among the community members. His family members will help him to run the business.

Sirakan hopes his business initiative will be lucrative and increase the family income. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a kiosk and start a grocery store there

loans.name: Bonu

texts.ru: Бону живет в районе Гончи. Ей 43 года. Она заботливая жена и мать. У нее трое детей. Бону на протяжении 15 лет занимается растениеводством и животноводством. Ей в этих деятельностях помогает муж и дети. Бону имеет орошаемый участок земли, на котором выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Одновременно она разводит коров и овец для продажи. Бону очень трудолюбивый человек. Она никогда не боится тяжелой работы. Ей нравится то как она зарабатывает своим усердием и с поддержкой семьи. В данный момент Бону обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет закупить корову, несколько голов овец и корм для скота. Она надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Bonu lives in the Gonchi district of Tajikistan.  She is 43 years old, a caring wife and the mother of three children.  For the past 15 years she has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  Her husband and her children help her to run the farm.  She owns an irrigated plot of land on which she cultivates crops and she also raises cows and sheep for resale.  She is a very hardworking person who is never afraid of heavy labor.  She likes the fact that she is making a living thanks to her own efforts and the support of her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy a cow, a few sheep and some animal feed.  She is relying on your financial support.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a few sheep and some animal feed.

loans.name: Amite Jane

texts.en: To make a living, Amite Jane operates a general store in her village.  She has been doing this for more than four years. She earns well from this so she is able to provide the needs of her family.  She has successfully repaid her previous loans that she used in her business.  Currently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to sustain her business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase new grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Arbildo

texts.es:
Arbildo tiene de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la afgricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertence a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, gallinas y cuyes, brinda servicios agrícolas desde hace 16 años, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Arbildo is 40 years old, lives together with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, a community which deals in agriculture, commerce and ranching.  It is located in the city of Chiclayo which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He raises farmyard animals: ducks, hens and guinea pigs, providing agricultural services for 16 years.  He is an enterprising father: he has asked for this loan of 1000 Peruvian soles to buy formulated feed to fatten his animals in order to generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy formulated feed to fatten animals.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 38-year-old resident of Katoke in the Kawempe division. She is a single mother of four children, who are all in school.

She has a spare motor parts business which she started three years ago. With this business she has built a house and educated her children.  However, Harriet’s challenge is lack of enough capital to boost her business and this has significantly retarded her business since she doesn’t have the variety of goods demanded by her customers. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX in order to boost her business so that she can increase her sales.

Harriet is a dedicated, hardworking and determined woman of the 21st century.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es: Eduardo de 23 años de edad es soltero y habita en casa propia desde hace 4 años. Eduardo es agricultor y albañil, de esta forma se gana la vida honradamente y mantiene la economía del hogar. Desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda pero no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de plancha de cemento, ladrillos, cemento, hierro, etc. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Eduardo is 23 years old. He is single and has lived in his own house for four years. Eduardo is a farmer and a brick-layer. In this way he earns an honest living  and maintains the economy of his household. He wants to construct a septic tank for his house, but he does not have the available capital to make the disbursement. To do this, he is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of a cement slab, bricks, cement, iron, etc. He states that he has the ability to pay that the loan entails.

loans.use: o buy a cement slab, bricks, cement, and iron to construct a septic tank.

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru: Гулбарг 47-летняя замужняя женщина, проживает в районе Яван с мужем, тремя сыновьями, невесткой и дочерью. Ее муж работает прорабом. Старший сын работает в стоматологии, остальные сыновья учатся, а дочь и невестка домохозяйки. Сама Гулбарг сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. Она занимается шитьем. Четыре года назад она у себя дома открыла швейное дело и до сих пор продолжает эту деятельность. Ей помогает невестка. Сейчас швейная машинка Гулбарг имеет технические неполадки, которые необходимо устранить. Она просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать швейную машинку, а также приобрести профессиональный столик вместе со стулом. Этот кредит ей очень важен для продолжения деятельности.
texts.en:
Gulbarg, age 47, lives in the Yavan district with her husband, her three sons, one daughter and one daughter-in-law.  Her husband is a construction foreman. Her oldest son works in dentistry and the other two are still studying.  Both her daughter and daughter-in-law are homemakers.  

Gulbarg makes a living from home and is involved in sewing.  Four years ago, she launched her own sewing business from home and she is still working in this field.  Her daughter-in-law helps her to run the business.  

Gulbarg is currently experiencing some technical difficulties with her sewing machine, which needs to be repaired.  She is taking a loan to repair her sewing machine and to buy a working table and stool. This loan is very important to her, as it will allow her to continue her activity.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and buy a working table and stool.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell in her store.

Gina has been in this business for six years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. 
In the future Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, sugar, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell in her store

loans.name: Irma Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Irma carolina Es propietaria de un mini café internet ubicado en la colonia Jerusalén 
Ella se ayuda con créditos y su negocio crece dia con dia, los creditos le han ayudado mucho porque cada crédito le ayuda para poder comprar una maquina nueva para poder ayudar y brindar un buen servicio a las personas que viven dentro de su comunidad ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y capaz de poder desenvolverse dentro de su comunidad  y espera en DIOS poder seguir adelante y con mucha responsabilidad poder llevar a cabo sus pagos…  actualmente  ella desea un nuevo crédito para la compra de una maquina y  y un mueble para colocarlo dentro de su negocio y con ello ayudar a su familia ya que tiene el tiempo necesario para poder estar con sus hijos sin necesidad de Salir de su casa  actualmente terminó un crédito y espera en DIOS trabajar de la misma manera con el que se le otorgue….
texts.en: Irma Carolina has an internet café located on Jerusalen Street.  She gets help from loans and her business grows daily.  The loans have helped her very much because each one helps her to buy a new machine so that she can provide good service to the people who live in her community.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person, capable of making her payments.  Currently she wants a new loan so that she can buy another machine and a piece of furniture to set it on.  This way she will be able to help her family now that she has time to spend with her children without having to leave the home.  She just finished with a loan and she hopes in God to be able to work the same way with the one she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Shayira est une commerçante d’une expérience de 10 ans, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 8 enfants dont 7 sont déjà mariés et 1 qui continue à étudier. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Amkeni ». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises dans les périphéries de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint est un technicien de meubles (Menuisier). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari après récolte agricole.
