Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter deux motobycks et les soumettre dans le transport en commun et scolariser tous ses enfants pour les études universitaires. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Shayira is a vendor with 10 years of experience. She is 50 years old and the mother of eight children, seven of whom are already married and one is still studying. Shaiyra is a member of the "Amkeni" business association. She sells used clothing. She sets up her wares on the outskirts of  town. She is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. She would like to buy one bail of used clothing. Her husband is a cabinet maker. She launched her business with the loan received from her husband after the harvesting season. In the future, she would like to buy two motorbike in order to rent them out and to pay for all of her children's university studies. She thanks Hekima for  supporting female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking by providing loans at at time when there is an armed conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bail of used clothing.

loans.name: Elsa Dinora

texts.es: Elsa de 35 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 16 años y 14 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Elsa se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desea construir una pila para reguardar el agua y además, desea construir el techo del corredor ya que el material que tiene actualmente no es de buena calidad por lo que no es seguro. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, ladrillo, y madera. Confía que con lo que gana de su trabajo logará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Elsa, who is 35 years old, lives in her own house along with her two children, ages 16 and 14, who are now in school. Elsa has worked providing domestic services for a long time, and this is how she has managed to raise her children. She wants to construct a washing area to store water, and in addition, she wants to build the roof for the hallway, since the material that she has now is not of good quality, and so it is not reliable. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan, to invest in the purchase of sheets of galvanized metal, cement, bricks, and wood. She is confident that with what she earns from her work, she will manage to pay off the debt that the loan entails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, cement, bricks, and wood to construct a washing area and the roof of the hallway of her home

loans.name: Kimang

texts.en: Kimang is 35 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, her brother is a mechanic and arc welder. He makes an income of $6 each day. Because of a lack of funds, Kimang is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her brother’s business to increase her family’s income and make her family’s livelihood more stable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim is 61 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making fish paste to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her children are working in Thailand. They earn about $10 each day. 

To improve her family’s livelihood, Nim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fish to produce more fish paste to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to produce more fish paste to sell

loans.name: Tumendemberel

texts.en:
Tumendemberel is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a cafe since 2001 and accumulated vast amounts of experience in this field. 

Before running the cafe, he had been a truck driver between 1981 and 1991. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy equipment such as a dishwasher, pastry warmer and fryer. By making these purchases, he will increase the cafe's productivity and that in turn will contribute greatly to his families’ income. 

His children are all growing bigger and each passing day their needs also increasing. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a dishwasher, pastry warmer and fryer.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband who is joining her in the picture sells groceries at home. He makes an income of $7 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation situation, Saran is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her to reduce transportation expenses and easily transport groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to expand the grocery store and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetuya, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a program developer at a non-governmental-organization for three years. Her husband has the profession of welder and works at a steel factory. 

Using her previous loan, she has bought a freezer which helped her milk sales. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sofa for the incoming White Moon, the national holiday celebration of passing the harsh winter and welcoming spring. Every year, Mongolians renew something just before White Moon, and it can be anything, ranging from a small cup to a big sofa.

loans.use: to buy sofa

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim is 56 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband runs the business of renting generators and speakers for weddings and funeral ceremonies. He make an income of $10 per day. One of her children is working in Thailand. 

To improve her family’s security, Yim is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Саёра 46-летняя портниха. Она проживает в городе Исфара с мужем, двумя сыновьями, дочерью и невесткой. Ее муж предоставляет услуги по стройке и ремонту домов. Сама Саёра последние три года занимается шитьем. Она шьет шторы и занавески разного дизайна. Саёра относится к делу очень серьезно. К каждому заказу она подходит индивидуально и получает удовольствие от результата работ. Саёре помогает в этом деле ее единственная дочь. Сейчас она хочет расширить свое швейное дело и с этой целью обратилась за кредитом. Саёра собирается купить еще одну швейную машинку. Она планирует увеличить количество вышиваемых шторов и занавесок. Она нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Sayora, age 46, is a seamstress.  She lives in the city of Isfara with her husband, her two sons, her daughter and daughter-in-law.  Her husband works in construction and house repair.  Sayora herself has been involved in sewing for the past three years.  She sews curtains and drapes of different designs and takes her business very seriously.  Each one of her orders is custom-fit and she is happy with the results of her work.  Sayora's only daughter helps her to run the business.  She now wants to expand her activity and to do so, she is taking a loan.  She would like to buy an additional sewing machine in order to increase the quantity of curtains and drapes that she produces.  She really needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Sharifmoh

texts.ru: Шарифмох родилась 1959 года. Она родилась и выросла в столице Таджикистана. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Шарифмох занимается предпринимательской деятельности, а именно куплей продажей молочных продуктов. Данным видом деятельности она занимается более 20 лет, имеет опыт работы в этой сфере, постоянных клиентов, со слов клиентки бизнес проносить хороший доход. Муж Шарифмох –  Тохир работает бухгалтером. Семья проживает в трехкомнатной квартире, уровень жизни - средний.   Ее дочь Манижа поступила в Таджикский государственный университет на факультет Таджикской филологии. Шарифмох должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sharifmoh was born in 1959 in the capital of Tajikistan, where she grew into her adult years.  She is married and has 4 children.  Sharifmoh has a small business of buying and selling milk products.  She has been doing this for more that 20 years and has a lot of experience in this field and a number of permanent clients.  Her business turns a nice profit from year to year.  Sharifmoh's husband works as an accountant.  Her entire family lives in a three bedroom house, which provides them with an average standard of living.  

Recently, her daughter, Manizha, enrolled into the department of Philology at the Tajik State University.  Currently, Sharifmoh needs to pay for her daughter's tuition but she does not have enough money.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: To make a living, Gloria helps her husband working on their farm. They have been growing and harvesting rice for many years. She earns enough from this to provide for her family and had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy fertilizer. Currently, she is requesting a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic pesticides and a new variety of seeds. She wants to use her revenue to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticides and a new variety of seeds

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en: To make a living, Felicisimo owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in his community. He earns well from this to provide for his family and he has successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC. Currently, he took a new loan to purchase a new set of tires for his vehicle, which needs tire replacement. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were big for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nerissa dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: o pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan en la economía del hogar. María es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y sobre todo responsable.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada la cual comercializa de forma  ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Desea asegurar su vivienda por lo que  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para construir un cerco perimetral y construir el techo del corredor de la vivienda. Con el crédito comprará tela metálica, lámina y madera.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and adult children.  They help her financially.  Maria is a hardworking, enterprising woman and above she all is responsible.  She sells used clothing on foot through the local areas.  She wants to secure her home so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a perimeter fence and build the roof around her home.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chain link fencing, metal sheeting, and lumber.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es: Ana es casada, tiene 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo  de un año de edad,  ella inicio en  las ventas a la edad de  15 años, actualmente se dedica a la venta  de ropa y zapatos por catalogo, ella ahora desea obtener un  crédito para seguir invirtiendo y de esa manera obtener más ingresos para el hogar, su sueño es  tener un local, para dedicarse a tiempo completo a su negocio y no seguir  vendiendo  ambulantemente  y darle mayor seguridad a su hijo, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa y calzado.
texts.en: Ana is 24 years old, married, and has a one year old son.  She started selling at age 15 and currently sells clothing and shoes via catalog.  She is asking for a loan to continue investing into her business and increase her household income.  Her dream is to have a shop so she can devote her full time to her business, not have to continue selling on foot, and provide better security for her son.  She is asking for this loan to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Hazel Mariana

texts.es: Hazel de 30 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 8 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de antojitos típicos (tamales, pasteles de carne, enchiladas, etc.) desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y se gana la vida honradamente. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño sanitario y para reparar el cuarto de la cocina. Con el monto solicitado comprará: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así comenzar la construcción del baño lo antes posible.
texts.en: Hazel is 30 years old and lives under humble conditions with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8 who currently attend school.  She has been selling typical food (tamales, meat pies, enchiladas, etc.) for a long time and supports the household and earns an honest living this way.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a bathroom and repair her kitchen.  She will use the money to buy galvanized metal, lumber, nails, etc.  She hopes to get this loan and begin building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Nelson Alberto

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre trabajador, que a sus 38 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, un almacén de venta de ropa para hombres y niños; éste se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, en un local que le fue adjudicado por las autoridades de espacio público, trabaja solo todos los días de 9.00 am a 7:00 pm y, de esta forma genera los ingresos suficientes para llevar el alimento a su hogar en el que convive con su madre.
El cliente desea prepararse para la temporada decembrina, por lo que requiere el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (camisetas, jeans, chaquetas, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de los compradores; dando como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe.
El objetivo principal de Nelson es acreditar aún más su negocio, para hacerle frente a su mayor desafío que es la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector, afectando sus finanzas; por ello desea trabajar con empeño y dedicación para obtener los resultados que espera y poder dar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a su madre.
texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking 38 year old man and has his own business; a men’s and boy’s clothing store.  It’s located in the city center, in a location that was adjudicated by the public authorities.  He works alone every day from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm and generates sufficient income to provide income to his household.  He lives with his mother.

He wants to prepare for the December season and needs a loan to buy merchandise in quantity (shirts, jeans, jackets, and other things); so that he will have a variety to offer his customers to satisfy their diverse tastes and needs.  This will increase his income.

Nelson’s objective is to accredit his business so he can face his main challenge, which is the disloyal competition in the area, which affects his finances.  He wants to work with great endeavor and dedication to obtain the results he is looking for and be able to provide a better quality of life and wellbeing for his mother.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, tiene tres dependientes económicos que son sus hijos.La actividad económica que realiza es netamente agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva son papa, haba y cebada, en sus propias parcelas que son herencia de sus padres. Ya que quiere superarse solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado para engorde, de esta forma podrá incrementar su producción y obtener un mayor rendimiento para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Señor Gonzalo lives in a rural zone of the province of Tiraque. He has three economic dependents, who are his children. The work that he does is purely agricultural, and the principal products that he grows are potatoes, beans, and barley. He grows them on his own parcels of land that are an inheritance from his parents. Since he wants to better himself, he is applying for a loan to purchase cattle to fatten. In this way he will be able to increase his production and obtain a better return to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Tumenjargal, 37, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been rendering transportation services to local people by renting buses from private companies since 2010. Last autumn, she and her husband purchased an old house and a plot of land. They delayed house renovation because winter was coming to Mongolia. Now that spring is approaching, they want to begin house renovation. She is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband will repair and insulate their house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for themselves and their children. Also, the renovated house will reduce coal consumption greatly, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Thim is 53 years old. She is married and resides with her daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and raising cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband who is also shown in the picture is a chef. He makes an income of $4 each day. To improve her family’s finance, Thim is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cattle that will be used for farming and to produce calves for sale. By doing so, she would be able to improve her farming process and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to be used for farming and to produce calves for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 62 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Amada Pastora

texts.es: Doña es Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se  dedica al negocio de pulpería, el cual ha logrado de él, un negocio próspero y muy demandado. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo comprar los productos para sus clientes y obtener un crecimiento de su inventario. Solicita el crédito para comprar: pan, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, sodas, jabones, detergentes, entre otros con el fin de ofertar más productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que incrementara sus ventas y obtendrá mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Doña Amada is a native of the city of Esteli. She is in commerce. She has a grocery store, which has been successful for her. It is a prosperous business with a lot of demand. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since she was able to buy products for her customers and expand her inventory. She is applying for the loan to buy bread, rice, sugar, candies, sodas, soaps, and detergents, among other items, with the goal of offering more products. She judges that the loan will be of much help to her, since she will increase her sales and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy bread, rice, sugar, candies, sodas, soap, detergent, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Этого человека зовут Исроил. Ему 57 лет. Он глава семейства, любящий муж и ответственный отец. Исроил отец троих детей. У него два взрослых сына и одна семилетняя девочка. Он очень любит свою семью. Исроил вместе с семьей проживают в городе Худжанд. Жители Худжанда очень вежливые, культурные и гостеприимные. Таджикский народ всегда славился своим гостеприимством. И Исроил один из них. Кроме гостеприимства и вежливости таджикские женщины очень вкусно готовят. Вам повезет, если попробуете таджикскую кухню.
   Исроил всегда любил вкусно поесть. У многих людей от вкусной еды и десерта поднимается настроение, и уровень миролюбивости повышается. Исроил решил поднять всем жителям Худжанда уровень миролюбивости с помощью новой его нового бизнеса. Исроил хочет открыть цех по выпечке сладких пряников. Он нашел помещение и купил оборудование, но у него не хватило начального капитала для купли сырья (т.е. сахара, муки, масло и т.д.) поэтому он обратился за помощью. Он просит ему помочь купить сырье и начать выпускать пряники. Он надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
This man is named Isroil.  He is 57 years old, a head of the family, a loving husband and a responsible father.  Isroil has three children: two adult sons and a seven year old daughter.  He loves his family very much.  Together with his family, Isroil lives in the city of Khujand.  Residents of Khujand are always very polite, respectable and welcoming.  The people of Tajikistan have always been known for their hospitality, and Isroil is one of those people.  Besides hospitality and politeness, Tajik women are expert at preparing delicious food.  You can count yourself lucky if you get a chance to try some of the Tajik food. 

Isroil always loved to have a delicious meal.  On many people, a delicious meal has an uplifting effect.  Isroil decided to lift the spirits of everyone in Khujand by opening his new business.  Isroil wants to open a bakery for baking sweet gingerbread.  He has already found space and bought the necessary equipment, however he ran short of funds for purchasing raw ingredients such as sugar, flour and butter.  He is asking for help with the purchase of raw baking ingredients so he can start producing gingerbread.  He is counting on your support.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for baking gingerbread

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru: Нафиса родилась в 1969 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она работает медсестрой в поликлинике медсестрой. Нафиса является одной из хороших и опытных работников. Ее коллеги уважают и знают как добросовестную и порядочную женщину. Нафиса хочет купить компьютер для своих детей, но не имеет денег. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки компьютера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nafisa was born in 1969.  She is married and is raising two children.  Her husband works abroad in the Russian Federation.  She is working as a nurse at the local hospital.  Nafisa is a diligent and a hard-working person.  Her colleagues value her and know her as a respectable woman.  Nafisa wants to purchase a computer for her children but she does not have the money.  Her children are currently in high school.  She is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase a computer.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her children

loans.name: Ngorn

texts.en: Ngorn is 63 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a taxi driver who makes an income of $10 per day. One of his children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $5 daily. Due to lack of funds, Ngorn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase some materials for his child’s wedding ceremony. He hopes to run a grocery store for his wife at home in order to make additional income to stabilize his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase some materials for his child's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Villa

texts.en: Villa is married with two children. She helps her husband in their piggery business. They have been doing this for five years and she earns well for her family. She joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional piglets and feeds. She is hopeful to expand her business and to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 49 years old and single.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an additional income from fishing.

Belinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and a general store business. Emelia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to customers

loans.name: Amparo Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil unión libre, vive con el esposo y sus hijos de 17, 16 y 13 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Graciela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, ferlitizantes y abonos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la siembra y poder  progresar. El sueño es progresar y salir adelante y mejorar los productos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar a la playa.
texts.en:
Graciela is 34 years old. She has a common-law marriage, and she lives with her husband and their children, aged 17, 16, and 13, in Ventanas Canton within the Province of los Ríos. 

She is a member of the communal bank, San Francisco, which is located in the precinct of Pantano that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  
The people here work in agriculture and livestock—Graciela is a farmer, planting corn and rice. 

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase seed, fertilizer, and compost.  The loan will help her to purchase what she needs for planting, and to make headway. 

Her dream is to grow and move forward, and improve her produce—diseases are the challenges that confront her.
 
In her free time she likes to go to the beach.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Joecelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joecelyn works hard to support her family.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Joecelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna âgée de la cinquantaine, s’active dans le commerce depuis 3 ans seulement. Même si son commerce n’est pas aussi âgé, cela ne l’empêche pas de réaliser  ses objectifs avec. Sokhna est une femme remariée qui n’a d’enfants que de son ancien ménage. Présentement, elle travaille pour pouvoir mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus et à les faire coudre par un tailleur afin de revendre  cela dans le marché où elle reçoit beaucoup de commande. Sokhna n’a pas de charges sinon s’occupait de ses propres enfants : avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle épargne son argent en achetant de l’or qu’elle garde. Dès qu’en enfant obtient son Baccalauréat, elle revend l’or pour lui payer le voyage à l’étranger et lui permettre d’aller continuer ses études et ultérieurement d’aider les autres pour le même circuit. Elle achète aussi des terrains. Comme elle pense bien, ses enfants sont un investissement qui lui permettra de construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en: Mrs. Sokhna, around 50 years of age, has been working as a vendor for only three years. Even though her business is relatively new, it is already helping her achieve her goals. Sokha is remarried and has children only from her previous marriage. At present, she works in order to improve her children's flie conditions. She busy fabric and has a tailor sew outfits which she then sells at the market place, receiving a lot of orders. Her expenses are related to her children: thanks to revenues from her business, she saves money by purchasing gold.  As her children finish high school one by one, she resells some of the gold in order to pay for them to travel abroad, study, and eventually help others in the same manner. She also buys land plots. She thinks that investing in her children's [future] is an investment which will allow her to build her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy fabric in order to have sheets  made for resale.

loans.name: Zoubaida

texts.en: Zoubaida is a 47-year-old divorced woman who is responsible for caring for three members of her family.  She has been their sole breadwinner for fifteen years ago.  Zoubaida runs her convenience store in a well-managed way, to make sure that she can provide for her family with the necessary standards of living.  She has a very good reputation and is well known in her region. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter needs necessary to reply to customers' increasing requests.  She hopes to keep on developing her business through opening a larger shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter needs necessary to reply to customers' increasing requests

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store which she has been running now for five years. Her loan also helped in the educating her children while the income from her business assists their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
Mary Ann would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is a 30 year old lady from Vihiga County. She is married to Charles, who is a carpenter. They have five children between the ages of one and 13 years old.

Ann has a grocery business. She has had this business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to buy sacks of cereals for sale. 

The proceeds from her sales will be used in repaying the loan and saving. Her dream is to give her family a good life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals for sale.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 29. She is married with three children.  She sells foodstuffs and has spent eight years in the business.  With the loan, she would like to buy more corn flour, soaps and salt for sale.  The profits from the business will be used for renovating her house.  She was very happy about her previous loan and she bought a lot of corn flour which she then sold and boosted her business.

loans.use: to buy more corn flour, soaps and salt for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Al-Rafeeq Group

texts.en:
Al-Rafeeq Group consists of three members from Aden, Yemen. All of the members are women.

Anesa, 46, is a member of this group. Her husband works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing, but unfortunately the money he makes is really not enough to support the family adequately.

Two years ago, Anesa decided to help her husband with the family’s finances. She has been selling women's clothes to increase the family's income. She plans to expand her business. So, she applied for a second loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy more clothes in order to increase her income. She and other members thank Kiva lenders for financing their first loan.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In is 42 years old. She is married and is a resident of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has one child. She has been making two-handle baskets (open at one end) to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $1 each day. Her son is employed at the rice mill. He makes an income of $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, In is requesting a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s use. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motobike for her family's use

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Эту милую женщину зовут Холнисо. Она живет на районе Спитамен. Ей 35 лет. Она обзаведена семьей и работой. Холнисо живет с мужем и 19 летним сыном. Ее муж на данный момент нигде не работает и является безработным. Холнисо сама обеспечивает семью и пополняет семейный бюджет. Она занимается продажей велосипедов. Холнисо хочет защитить природу и надеется, что люди перейдут на экологическо-безопасный транспорт. Но чтобы заинтересовать покупателей, Холнисо хочет обновить свой товар. Она решила купить новые виды велосипедов, чтобы привлечь больше покупателей, но из-за того что у нее не достаточно средств, она просит Вас помочь ей, собрать не обходимую сумму. Помогите ей.
texts.en: This woman is named Kholniso.  She is 35 years old and lives in the Spitamen.  She has a family and a job.  Kholniso lives with her husband and her 19 year old son.  He husband is currently unemployed.  Kholniso is the breadwinner in the family who replenishes the family's budget by selling bicycles.  Kholniso wants to protect nature and hopes that people will transition to an environmentally friendly form of transport.  In order to capture the eye of potential customers, Kholniso wants to get the latest models into her shop.  However, she does not have enough money for this purchase, which is why she is asking for your help.  Please help her.

loans.use: To buy latest bicycle models in order to attract customers

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дилором имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе директором. Дилором всегда старается, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Ее дочь учится в университете. Она учится в столице Таджикистана. Дилором использует свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи продуктами питания. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Дилором запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для оплаты обучения своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom is a hard-working and a cheerful woman.  She is married and is raising 2 children.  Dilorom has been educated as a teacher.  She works as a principal at a high school.  Dilorom is always trying to give her children a good education.  Her daughter is currently going to the university in the capital of Tajikistan.  Dilorom uses most of her salary to provide her family with food.  Her husband works abroad in the Russian Federation.  Dilorom is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to pay for her daughter's university tuition.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's the university tuition

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: To make a living, Danilo manages his own retail store selling grocery goods in his village. He joined GDMPC to gain access to micro-finance services. He borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell, in order to gain more profit. In the future, Danilo wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Mary Joy has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Hazel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from e-loading (prepaid mobile loading). Hazel is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money in order to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remy is 52 years old and has children who are in school.

Remy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, paints, etc. for a new fishing boat.

Remy has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Remy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, paints, etc for a new fishing boat

loans.name: Johven

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Johven works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Johven is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Johven has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 53 years old and a married mother of five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Flordeliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Aracely Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar 	vive la señora Aracely, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  7 años y un bebé  de seis meses  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la localidad.
Doña Aracely se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo. Trabaja los ratos que está desocupada,  ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio del banco, le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Su sueño es algún día tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for its commerce, its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo and its people’s happiness.

Sra. Aracely lives here. She is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are 7 years old and six months old. The older child is in school. Her husband works at a gas station in the area.

Doña Aracely sells all kinds of clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories). She sells door to door and also in her home where her customers come when they need something. She works when she is not busy. She sells on credit and collects from her customers every fifteen days. She has had this business for more than four years, with which she helps her husband with household expenses.

She is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, perfume, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning. She enjoys it because she began her business with one of its loans. Her dream is to some day have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a hard-working woman. She is married. Nargis has had her own business for 3 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, etc. 

She has not had many customers recently and that’s why she decided to widen the assortment of her goods in the New Year season. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD. With it she is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as she wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers, and always keep her store well-stocked. 

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy food items for the New Year season

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 32 years old. He lives in the village of Lusahovit in the Tavush region. This young farmer lives with his parents. He is married and he has two children. From time to time, Artur goes to the Russian Federation to work. He is also engaged in farming and agriculture in his village with his mother and father. Artur loves farming and takes care of his farm cattle with pleasure. He has two cows, a bull, a piglet and twenty chickens. As the result of their hard work, this family manages to sell meat, dairy-products, eggs, a large variety of fruits and also emmer. Artur says that he loves his village and farming activities very much and he dreams of making it richer, wider and more profitable.

Artur asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several calves and also animal fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy several calves and also animal fodder for them.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1982. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a technician. Maha has been selling homemade perfumes at her house for 1 year. She started her business selling a small amount of perfumes. Now she is seeking to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of the needed materials for making different perfumes. Adding variety to her business will raise her sales so that she can be a good financial support for her husband. Because she doesn't have enough money to expand her business, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of the needed material for making different perfumes.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en: Yaser was born in 1975. He is married and a father of 3. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Yaser has been running his own gas cylinders store for 3 years. He started this business selling them at home and then he moved to an independent store. Yaser is planning to expand his business by expanding the amount of gas cylinders that he sells in order to raise his sales and income to cover his family's needs. Because unfortunately he doesn't have enough money to expand his business, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders for his business.

loans.name: Luara

texts.en: Luara, a 60-year-old woman, lives in a village called Akhalsopeli, in Senaki district.  She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law.  Luara's husband works as a cleaner and gets 260 GEL monthly.  The family also runs agricultural activities.  They have land where they grow different kinds of vegetables for family use.  Luara runs a poultry business; she has hens and sell eggs.  The family decided to expand their husbandry and has requested a loan for purchasing a cow.  The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products like cheese and yogurt for sale. They will also use the milk products for family consumption.  The new business initiative will give Luara a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Flavienne

texts.en:
Flavienne is 60 years old. She has one child aged 22, who is enrolled in school. 

Flavienne sells beers and has been running the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a married woman who was born in 1976. She is a mother of 8. Her husband works at a governmental entity. Wedad has been running her mini market for 7 years. She started this business selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. Then she decided to expand her business by opening her own independent mini market. Now she wants to increase the merchandise in her mini market with a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and income in order to cover her children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so and so has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more goods and food products to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman who was born in 1971. She is a mother of five children. Her husband works in agriculture. All of the family are living in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Fatima has been running her project of selling blankets for one year to support her husband in covering their childrens' needs. She is now seeking to add selling winter clothes to her business, to raise her sales as the winter is coming. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to re-sell in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake.  Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area.  Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes.  Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

John is married and has six children.  Both he and his wife have been farming for twenty years now.  They are currently growing watermelon, sunflowers and cassava. John is interested in beekeeping because compared to other farming activities, it does not require a lot of land, it takes less time to manage, and it generates more income.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care.  He likes to work with Honey Care because it will help him gain more knowledge in beekeeping.  He intends to use the proceeds from beekeeping to pay for fees and provide for the basic needs of his family.  His hope for the future is to expand his honey project and become the biggest producer of honey in his village.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en: Sumaya is a married woman who was born in 1983.  She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and 7 sons and daughter.  Sumaya has been raising sheep and selling their products for one year.  She started her project selling a few sheep.  Now she seeks to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of sheep in order to raise their productivity, which will lead to raising their sales and income.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of sheep for her business

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world.  Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry.  A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe.  Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Consolata is married and has seven children.  Both she and her husband are farmers.  They have been farming for thirty years now and are currently growing amaranth, maize, sunflowers and beans on their land.  Her husband is very old and is currently not working.  Consolata is excited about beekeeping as it will be an opportunity for her to earn extra income and the honey she will get will be a good source of medicine for coughs and burns.

This is Consolata’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the money generated from beekeeping to pay for fees, provide for their basic needs and to support her farming activities.  Consolata’s hope for the future is to expand her honey project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a married woman who was born in 1969. She is a mother of 6. Her husband is a driver. A year ago, she decided to help her husband financially by selling home products and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of home products to raise her sales to help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten was born in 1976.  She is a single woman living in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat with her parents and 5 siblings.  She works as an accountant in a private company.  At the same time she runs her project of selling cosmetic products, accessories and perfumes, which she has held for 2 years in order to support her family financially because of the financial crisis she faced.  Now she wants to add new cosmetic products to her sales that might attract more customers and raise her sales.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Joab

texts.en:
Joab lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Joab is married and has eight children. His wife runs a small grain shop. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty-five years now and they are currently growing grains, butternut squash, watermelon and sunflowers in their farm. Joab is looking forward to beekeeping as it will help in the conservation of his small forest and also because he loves bees.

This is Joab’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because of the support it offers in beehive management and the provision of a market for his honey. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for school fees for his children and to cater to their basic needs. Joab’s hope for the future is to get better in handling bees and to learn more about other bee products.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh was born in 1992. He is single and lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt with his 3 siblings and his parents. Saleh decided to help his family financially after the financial crisis they have been facing by running his cafe. He has been doing this for 1 year. He started his business selling hot and cold drinks. Then he started expanding his business until he opened a cafe. Now he wants to buy a refrigerator where he can keep cold drinks and a coffee maker to raise his productivity and profit to support his family. He doesn't have enough money to do this, so he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a coffee maker for his business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives outside of Sindo, close to Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake.  Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflowers, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes.  Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Gilbert is married and has eight children.  Both him and his wife are farmers, and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, groundnuts, and sunflowers. Gilbert's sunflower crops will be especially good for his bee colonies, as bees enjoy feeding on the nectar from the flowers.  Gilbert is excited to start working with Honey Care because he now has access to modern Langstroth beehives instead of the traditional hives usually used in his region. 

This is Gilbert's first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to further invest in beehives and beekeeping equipment.  His hope for the future is to be able to educate his children on beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere.  Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares.  Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Joseph is married and has seven children.  Both he and his wife are farmers.  They have been farming for twenty-five years and they are currently keeping poultry and growing beans, cotton, bamboo and sunflowers.  Joseph is interested in beekeeping as it a good source of food and income and because it is not very involving compared to other farming projects.

This is Joseph’s first loan.  He likes working with Honey Care because it will provide him with a market for his honey and because it will offer him training on beekeeping.  He plans to use the income generated from beekeeping to start a small business for his family.  His future hope is to invest more in beekeeping and to start a small shop.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Peter is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now. They are currently growing beans, maize and sunflowers on their farm. Peter is looking forward to beekeeping as it will give him an opportunity to earn extra income.

This is Peter’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beekeeping to pay for his children’s school fees and provide for their basic needs. Peter’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is 22 years old and married to a farmer.She and her husband have been working hard to earn a living. Maricar would like to take out a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to keep her farming business productive. She knows that this loan amount will be of great assistance in improving her farm. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to achieve better yields by next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides used for farming

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is married. She earns an income from her buy-and-sell business, selling cosmetic products in her village. She wants to continue her education so that she can gain profit from it. She joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional cosmetic products to sell. In the future, she wants to have a better career that leads her to a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: To make a living, Felipa manages a retail business selling home products in her community. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well from this. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy additional knives, plastic wares and ready-to-wear clothes to sell. She wants to improve the business to have a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional knives, plastic wares and ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is involved in three different sectors: construction worker, farmer and motor taxi driver. After farming, he works as a construction worker. If there is no construction work, he will run a motor taxi service. Typically, he earns about $5 each day. One of her children is employed in a cigarette factory and earns about $5 per day. To improve her family’s livelihood, Channa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and fuel to cultivate rice in the dry season. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and fuel to grow rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en: Yoen is 41 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is an electrician who makes an income of $8 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Yoen is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase farmland to expand her farming business. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland for other crop cultivation and send her youngest child to a good school. Moreover, she wants to build a bathroom and toilet to provide hygiene living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to expand her farming business

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda works hard to support her family. Edda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 8,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Edda has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Edda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, rice, sugar, flour, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sandy 50097 Group

texts.en:
Samaher is the featured borrower of Sandy 50097 group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to make sure they can cover their needs and develop their livelihoods.
Samaher is a 39-year-old married mother of three children.  She has been working in the embroidery business for sixteen years.  She is well known in her region for her special talents in her domain and the special prices she requests.  Samaher is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter materials to work on and provide her customers with a variety of choices.  She will also use part of the loan to provide her family with the necessary living needs requested for the coming winter season.  She hopes that in the future she can establish her own retail shop where she can display her products in a very attracting way.  Samaher is the first lady standing at the right side of the picture. As for the other group members Zahiya is at the center and Janaa is the first from the left.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter materials to work on and provide her customers with a variety of choices.  She will also use part of the loan to provide her family with the necessary living needs requested for the coming winter season.

loans.name: Dar Group

texts.en:
Lema, who is in her mid thirties, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school and the other one is still small. She has been running a business of a wholesale general store for seven years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Lema's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to cover household expenses and to buy small items for the store. She will use this loan to buy items for the wholesale general store. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.  

Lema will share this loan with her loan group "Dar" - with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her wholesale general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of hair relaxer, hair extensions, pomades, and hair dryers.

loans.name: Febronie

texts.en: Febronie is 31 years old. She is a mother of three and has been in business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and sodas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Fidelia Mariela

texts.es: Fidelia tiene 29 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Madre soltera de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante, para garantizarle un futuro a su hijo. Es su único negocio con el que ha trabajado; con el objetivo de tener ingresos en su familia. Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en los productos para su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: golosinas, gaseosas, pan, huevos, arroz, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar los productos que más demandan sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es crecer más en su pulpería.
texts.en: Fidelia is 29 years old, native to the city of Estelí and a single mother of one son. She is a shopkeeper that makes a living through her convenience store. Fidelia started this business a few years ago, and with a lot of effort has been able to get ahead and guarantee a future for her son. This is the only business that she has worked in, with the objective of having income for her family. Her goal is to continue investing in products for her business. Fidelia is requesting this loan in order to buy candies, sodas, bread, eggs and rice, among other things. She is aiming to offer the products demanded most by her customers. Fidelia believes the loan will be of much help to her considering that she will be able to increase her sales and obtain better profits. Her plan for the future is to grow her convenience store further.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, bread, eggs and rice, among other things.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 60 year old widow who lives with her son in the village of Kvaloni, Khobi district. The family runs agricultural activities. They have 2 cows, a pig and a boar. They sell milk and cheese to the local market. 

Liana is a very hard-working woman and she always has high quality products. Now she has decided to open a general store in her village and needs money for that business. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Liana to get a loan of 1500 Gel and start her business. Liana thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  

With support of the Start Up program Liana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry and fresh fish, pig feet, chicken feet, and frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Obloyor

texts.ru: Облоёр добродушный и очень трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Облоёр обратился в Арванд для того, чтобы получить кредит на покупку  скота. Облоёр старается работать не покладая рук, чтобы иметь хороший доход и обеспечивать свою семью. Он уже несколько лет занимается животноводством. Это хороший бизнес, от которого он получает хорошую прибыль. На сегодня он имеет несколько голов скота, но он желает расширить поголовье своего скота, чтобы иметь больше дохода в семье. Он обучен этому делу от своего отца и знает все тонкости этого дела. Сейчас он хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота, но для этого ему нужны денежные средства.  Не имея нужной суммы Облоёр обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Obloyor is a kindhearted and very hardworking man of 42. He is married and has three children, and has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase cattle. Obloyor does his best to work tirelessly so that he has good income and can take care of his family. He has been working in animal husbandry for a few years already. It is a good business from which he receives decent profits. At the present time he has a few head of cattle, but he wants to expand his herd in order to increase his family's income. He learned this trade from his father and knows all of its intricacies. Now he wants to buy a few more head of cattle, but to do this he needs money that he doesn't have, which is why he has turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase cattle. He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a single woman, aged 37. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her parents and 14 siblings. 

Nisreen has been supporting her family financially by selling food products for two years and found it profitable. Then she decided to expand her business by opening her own independent mini market. Now, she wants to stock her mini market with a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and income in order to cover her family's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her mini market.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya was born in 1965. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her retired husband and six children. Her husband currently works as a teacher. Raya has been supporting her husband financially since three years, making home products and crafts using hay. She is now planning to raise her profit by buying sewing tools and a larger quantity of hay to raise her productivity and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing tools and a larger quantity of hay for her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad was born in 1962. He is married and has eight children. Ahmad has been running his own used furniture store since 18 years ago. He started his project selling a few pieces of furniture. Now, he wants expand his project and to raise his profit to be able to cover his children's needs and to provide them with the best education by buying a larger quantity of used furniture to sell. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more used furniture for his business

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура трудолюбивая женщина. Она уже более 5 лет занимается изготовлением и продажей национальных пирожков «самбуса». Она продает свою продукцию местным жителям. Мастура имеет 4 детей. Трое из ее детей не совершеннолетние. Мастура хочет, чтобы ее дочери научились ее работу и продолжили ее бизнес. Мастура является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж строитель и имеет сезонную работу. Мастура планирует строить новый дом, так как ее жилой дом имеет плохое состояние. Мастура запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич, песок и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mastura is a hardworking woman. She has more than five years of experience baking and selling traditional pastries called "sambusa" to local residents. Mastura has four children, three of whom are not yet grown up. She wants her daughters to learn her trade and to continue her business. Mastura is the main breadwinner of her family, as her husband is a construction worker and works seasonally. Mastura plans to build a new house because hers is in poor condition. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and so forth. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, bricks, and sand for building a new house

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan is 44 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 per day. Due to a lack of funding, Nan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
As the married mother of nine children, Azucena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Azucena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store business.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old, a married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Analiza has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to pays for laborers salaries for the the harvest of sugarcane.
