Lorna has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and also earns additional income from tricycad transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pays for laborers salaries for the the harvest of sugarcane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her vegetables and food items.

loans.name: Uziel

texts.en: Uziel is a father of two children. He is 43 years old. He owns a bar and has been in the business for the past eight years. He has requested a loan to buy more beers and refrigerators for sale. With the profits from the business, he will renovate the house. He is very happy with the past loan, which helped to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer for sale.

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya was born in 1966. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. They are all living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Marka.

Kefaya has been trying her best to support her husband in covering their children's needs after she noticed the financial crisis he is facing. She started her project of sewing clothes at home 5 years ago using 1 sewing machine and selling her products to her friends and neighbors. Now she wants to buy another sewing machine to expand her project and to raise her productivity and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her project

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en:
Because Maisa is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Maisa is a married woman who was born in 1984. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her husband. Her husband is a truck driver. 

She decided to help her husband financially by selling blankets a year ago and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales as the winter is coming, as well as adding perfumes sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is from  Dullan, Aloran, Misamis  Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old and is married with children.
Richel has applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Richel is asking for financial assistance of Php 7,000 to buy stock of basic commodities. Through this she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy stock for basic commodities

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is 51 years old, married and  a resident of  Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She has earneed a living through egg production for a number of years.

She is a member of PMPC for 3 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy eggs to sell.

 Lenita deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy stock for egg production

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 42 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Celestina has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Celestina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Alejandra De Los Angeles

texts.es: Alejandra es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica a la venta de comidas y refrescos. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado incrementar sus ganancias, y así suplir todas sus necesidades. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar: Azúcar, Arroz, Aceite, Frijoles etc. al por mayor. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer más productos y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Alejandra is a native of the city of Granada. Her work is selling foods and beverages. She feels grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since she has succeeded in improving her earnings and thus supplying all her necessities. She is applying for a new loan to make wholesale purchases of sugar, rice, oil, beans, etc. She expects that the loan will be a great help to her since she will be able to offer more products and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, beans, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Masrakhon

texts.ru: Масрахон добрая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Масрахон и ее семья живут на северной части Таджикистана. Ее дети работают в Российской Федерации. Масрахон более 23 лет занимается бизнесом. Она торгует на местном рынке тканями. Масрахон имеет свою торговую точку. Она имеет регулярных покупателей и поэтому она хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки тканей для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Masrakhon is a kind woman. She is married and has three children. Masrakhon and her family live in the north of Tajikistan. Her children work in the Russian Federation. Masrakhon has been in business for over 23 years. She sells fabric at the local market. Masrakhon has her own sales stand. She has repeat customers and would like therefore to expand her working capital. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS to bolster her working capital. She is awaiting your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy fabric.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is  52 years old, married and a resident of Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through sale of retail products, specifically kitchen utensils.

She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of Php 12,000.00 to buy stock for her business.

Marieta deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy stocks for retail business

loans.name: Wend Teldo Group

texts.fr:
Mr AMADO est responsable du groupe WEND TELDO. Il se porte bien. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr  vend  pagnes traditionnel (pagnes Faso Danfani) depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de kouritenga  en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Il  veut s’acheter  25 pagnes Faso Danfani.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut  réinvestir  dans son activité. Il ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Amado is the leader of the Wend Teldo group. He is doing well. He is married and has four children. The eldest is 11 years old and the youngest is one year old. Three of his children go to school. He has five dependents. Mr. Amado  has been selling traditional "pagnes" fabric (of Faso Danfani type) for 10 years. He stocks up at the Kouritenga market in town. His customers are both men and women. He would like to buy 25 sets of Faso Danfani pagnes. With his revenue, he would like to reinvest in his business. His goal is to buy a plot of land and to improve his family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy 25 sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Club De La Amistad” conformada por 09 socios  trabajadores que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo. Margarita de 49 años, es casada y tiene 04 hijos independientes. Hace 02 años que cuenta con una bodega en su domicilio. Este negocio surgió gracias a la motivación de su familia. Se siente feliz pues con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante a su familia. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “El Club De La Amistad” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Margarita  se encuentra de pie es la primera de lado izquierdo, viste blusa floreada y falta ploma.
texts.en:
This is the “El Club De La Amistad” group, made up of nine hard-working members, who have been gradually improving their situation over the course of time. 

Margarita is 49, married and has four grown-up children. She has had a small grocery store in her home for two years. This business came about thanks to her family's encouragement. She is happy, as with a great deal of effort she has helped her family get ahead in life.

She will use the the loan she has requested to purchase groceries, drinks and candy. To keep operating her business is her greatest desire. 

The “El Club De La Amistad” group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. Margarita is standing, and is first one on the left, wearing a flower-print blouse and grey skirt.

loans.use: To buy groceries, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has four children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 10 years. 

She has requested the loan to buy more types of fabric. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more types of fabric to sell.

loans.name: Henriette Tog

texts.fr:
Madame Henriette Tog est une femme âgée de 57 ans qui fait de la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle a déménagé en 2000 dans la région de Mbour après le décès de son époux et à redémarré son activité laissée en rade pendant un an en 2001. Elle achète la marchandise qu’elle place dans le marché, reste une semaine ou deux pour faire le tour et récupérer son argent. Elle est toujours veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont heureusement 3 d’entre eux travaillent et l’appuient dans la gestion de la maison. Les autres sont âgés et reste un, qui n’est pas encore majeur dont elle a la charge. 
Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle a pu réfectionner petit à petit la maison et pense à investir dans le domaine du transport.
texts.en: Mrs Henriette Tog is 57 years old and works as a cosmetics vendor. After the death of her husband in 2000, she moved to the Mbour region and relaunched her business, after putting it on hold for year, in 2001. She buys her merchandise to bring it to the market. She spends a week or two to go around the markets and recover her investment. She did not remarry after being left a widow. She has six children; fortunately, three of them work and help support the household. The others are grown, and there is only one child remaining who is still a minor and in her care. With the income from her business, she has been able to make house repairs little by little. She thinks of investing in a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers, clothes pins, under clothes, body cream, diapers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 67, is from Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married and has children. For years she has sold home products to make money to help cover her family’s needs, but she would like to expand her business to meet customer demand.

Felisa became a member of PMPC in 2011. She is applying for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy additional home products to sell. With the help of PMPC and Kiva her request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy additional home products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganaría, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados chanfainita, hígado, caldo verde, chaufa y otros, frente a mercado de su distrito, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, sacos de arroz, bidones de aceite, verduras, embutidos entre otros y una segunda parte para la compra de utensillos de cocina y de esta manera tener la facilidad para atender a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 23 years old. She lives with her son in the Cayalti district. The people of the district work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. The district is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells prepared foods such as chanfainita (a Peruvian stew made with beef lung, hominy, and potatoes), liver, caldo verde (a soup made with potatoes and vegetables, chaufa (Peruvian fried rice), and other dishes in front of the market in her district. She is an entrepreneurial mother. She has applied for a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase supplies for the preparation of her dishes: sacks of rice, cans of oil, vegetables, and sausages, among other items. A second part of the loan is to buy cooking utensils and in this way have the facility to serve her customers, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an increased number of her rechargeable cards for resale.

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lablonde  est une commerçante, trésorière et membre de l’association d’affaires « Ujumbe »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, mariée  et mère de 2 enfants qui sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse de ciment. Elle installe sa marchandise tout au long de la route principale dans la ville. Elle commença ses affaires  par le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration  publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de ciment. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son activité, construire une maison, vêtir, nourrir ses enfants et préparer leur scolarisation. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Lablonde is a vendor. She is a member and the treasurer of the Ujumbe business grip. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two young children. Lablonde sells cement. She sets up her merchandise along the principal route of the town. She launched her business with a starting capital received from her husband, who works in public administration. Later on she obtained a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution. She has been in this business for five years. This new loans will allow her to buy three bags of cement. She would like to expand her business, build a house, pay for the clothing and nutrition of their children and prepare for their school start. Finally, she sincerely thanks Hekima for allowing female entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional banking, to become financially autonomous, especially at this difficult time given the armed conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy three bags of cement.

loans.name: Blan

texts.fr:
BLAN est âgé de 54 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son époux dans la sous préfecture de KELEYA, Région de SIKASSO.
Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales, activité dans laquelle il est apprécié et sollicité. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le cinquième prêt il est à son sixième qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) et de haricot auprès des paysans producteurs de KELEYA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 1 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU
BLAN  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: Blan is 54 years old. He lives with his five children and spouse in the Keleya sub-prefecture in the Sikasso region. From an early age, he started earning a living, specifically buying and reselling cereals. He has a good reputation in this business and attracts many customers. In order to meet steadily growing demand, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. Having duly repaid his fifth loan, he is now on his sixth loan, which will allow him to buy two tons [4409 lbs] of cereals (corn, millet, fonio [a type of millet cereal] ) and beans from farmers in Keleya and nearby. He will keep the produce at least one month before reselling. He sells main wholesale to a customer base composed of resellers coming from big cities, such as Bamako and Ouelessebougou. Blan hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 60,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the  loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elham Group

texts.en:
Elham is a group consisting of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. 

Aqdar is a 31-year-old married woman; she has four children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. 

She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 6 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor  escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
El crédito lo realiza para el negocio del esposo el cual  es un vendedor ambulante, vende artículos para el hogar (planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, tostadoras, ollas, platos, entre otros artículos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo donde le dan precio para comerciante. Su esposo lleva en esta actividad  9 años.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para que su esposo compre planchas, ollas, licuadoras, entre otros artículos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace siete años y está muy agradecida ya que así ella puede ayudar a su esposo a través de los créditos otorgados por la institución. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] Credit Group meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being a commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Carmen lives here.  She is 35 and has a common law husband with whom she has three kids, aged 14, 11, and 6.  The older two are in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Carmen's husband is a salesman, and she requests this loan for his business.  He is a mobile vendor who sells home appliances (irons, fans, blenders, toasters, pots, plates, and other items).  He works every day from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.  He buys his merchandise in Portoviejo where he can get bulk prices.  Carmen's husband has been in this business for nine years.  He will use this loan to buy irons, pots, blenders, and other items.  Carmen has been in the credit group for seven years and she is very thankful for it since it allows her to help her husband via the loans provided by the institution.  Her dream is to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy irons, pots, blenders, and other items to sell

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme de 45 ans, veuve et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de lui permettre de se diversifier et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital (agrandir son activité) et subviendront au x besoins de la famille (épargne aussi)
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 45-year-old woman, a widow and mother of one child.  For four years she has owned and managed a shop selling food items in a neighborhood of the city. 

She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of goods in order to allow her to diversify and increase her revenue. The profits generated will be reinvested in her capital (to expand her activity) and will provide for the family’s needs (as well as savings).

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Kasiimu

texts.en:
Kasiimu is a married man of 48 years old. He lives in a  rural area with his family and he has ten children, his children are aged 25, 23, 20,18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6. Six out of ten are still attending schools.

Kasiimu is a farmer who deals in agriculture specifically matooke growing and he supplements his family income with cereal farming that is seasonal.
Kasiimu started his agriculture business in 1984 and since then he has been able to achieve a lot out of it.

He started his agriculture business because the land for him to cultivate on a large scale was available; he says his clients are traders from the city. And he has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers for the banana plantation so that he can get high yields. Kasiimu hopes to be the largest supplier of bananas  in the whole district.

Kasiimu faces the challenge of lack of enough money to maintain his banana plantation and poor weather conditions which affect the crops.
He describes himself as a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa María, es madre soltera de dos hijos, con su labor como asistente del hogar en una casa particular esta mujer sale adelante con muchos esfuerzos junto a su familia. Solicita el crédito para  comprar materiales de construcción, para realizar un cuarto de habitación y poder alquilarlo y así obtener  más ingresos que mucha falta hace.
texts.en: Doña Rosa Maria is a single mother of two. With her work as a domestic helper in a private home, she forges ahead with great effort together with her family. She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials to make a bedroom to rent out. That way she will obtain much-needed income.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 62 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez in Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. She makes and sells snacks, earning about 4,000 PHP a month doing so.

Felicidad is applying for a 14,900 PHP loan through PMPC to buy malagkit ( sticky) rice, bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and other ingredients to make her snacks. She has been a member of PMPC for almost four years and is pleased with the products and services offered by the cooperative.

In the future Felicidad hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make her snacks.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz, 37, is married and has one child. She lives in Lawagan, Labason in Zamboanga del Norte.

For many years Maria Paz has owned a store from which she sells blouses, jeans and flip-flops. She earns about 5000 PHP a month doing so.

Maria Paz has been a member of PMPC for three years. She is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan to invest in her business. She hopes to see her business continue to improve.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Betty De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Betty de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta 8 grado de educación básica, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad que vive con ella y que estudia 7 grado de educación básica.

Ella se dedica a realizar trabajos de costura, oficio que lo practica desde hace diez años, lo aprendió de su madre, pues ella también se dedicaba a la costura.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para remodelar una habitación de su casa, reparará el techo y modificará el piso.

Ella desea que a futuro su hija también aprenda el oficio de costura, además de que termine sus estudios, pues será un oficio extra para que  ella pueda trabajar honradamente.
texts.en:
Señora Betty is 56 years old. She went to school through the 8th grade of basic education. She is a single mother and has a daughter who is 15 and lives with her; her daughter went to school through the 7th grade of basic education.

Señora Betty works in dressmaking, a trade that she has practiced for 10 years. She learned it from her mother, since she also worked in dressmaking.

The loan that she is applying for from CrediCampo is to remodel a room in her house. She will repair the roof and change the floor.

In the future she wants her daughter to also learn the trade of dressmaking, in addition to completing her schooling, since it will be an additional trade so that she can work honorably.

loans.use: to remodel a room of her house by repairing the roof and changing the floor.

loans.name: Blessing Iii Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you members of the "Blessing III" group for the second time. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to further expand their respective businesses. Featured leader is Yei. Yei is a native of Manjamad. He is 54 years old. He is married to a farmer and the couple has 2 children who are attending secondary schools. Yei has been a businessman for 20 years now. He sells house building materials. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of house building materials to add to his shop.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of house building materials to add to his shop

loans.name: Francisca Magali

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Francisca, tiene años 32 de edad, está casada, aun no tiene  hijos pero está en su 7 mes de embarazo. Su marido es comerciante. 
Doña Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con esto ayudar a su  marido a salir adelante,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, así como también a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los  días por horas, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Lleva más de 12  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Su sueño es que su bebé nazca sano.
texts.en: El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza [New Hope Loan Group] meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people. Here lives the lady Francisca. She is 32 years old and married. She still does not have children but she is in her 7th month of pregnancy. Her husband is a shopkeeper. Doña Francisca is a very determined woman who likes to make do by herself and in doing so help her husband to get ahead. She works selling clothes of all types as well as selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Her way of selling is door to door and by orders her customers make. Doña Francisca works every day for hours. She gives loans to her customers and collects every week. She has more than 12 years of experience in this business and it is going very well for her. This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for more than 4 years and she likes it because of the help they give her to get ahead. Her dream is for her baby to be born healthy.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all .the needed items for building new greenhouses

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beathe is 34 years old. She is married with three children between two and eleven years old.  With the loan, she wants to buy more equipment for her beauty salon. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business.She was very excited with the previous loan, and she says that an impact on her business was visible to every one, she has gained many profits.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials for the hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.fr: Rachel est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède un atelier de couture où elle confectionne et vend des vêtements à base de tissu pagne dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant des tissu afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa jeune famille
texts.en:
Rachel is a 33-year-old woman, single and the mother of one child. For five year, she has owned a sewing workshop in a neighborhood of the city. She makes and sells clothes made from “pagnes”.

She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of raw material. She will buy fabric in order to meet her customers' demand and increase her revenue.

The profit generated will be reinvested in her activity and will provide for the young family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise est une femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle commercialise les vivres secs (sel, sucre, poisson fumés, arachide, huile de palme, maïs) dans un quartier de la ville depuis 12 ans. afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Denise is a 29-year-old woman and mother of two children. For the last 12 years, she has been selling dry goods (salt, sugar, smoked fish, groundnuts, palm oil, corn) in a neighborhood of the city.

She is requesting a loan in order to meet her customers’ demand and increase her revenues and augment her stock of goods. The profit generated will be reinvested in her activity and will provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Red Rose Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her late thirties, is married and has a daughter in school. For the past five years she has had a shop from which she sells drinks like soda, juice and water. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. a day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Flora is the leader of this four-member group called Red Rose. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans prior to this request. She now is applying for a 2,600,000 TZS loan through Tujijenge Tanzania on behalf of her group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

With her portion of the loan Flora will restock her shop with more drinks. She will use her profits to help pay for school fees, groceries and the house she is building. She dreams of seeing her business continue to grow.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more drinks.

loans.name: Nagendra

texts.en:
Nagendra is Managing Director of Navachetana Enterprises, an organization working towards bringing essential products to poor rural communities and promoting rural development. He has been engaged in the field of poverty alleviation for over 20 years and was inspired to form Navachetana Foundation in 1999, under which Navachetana Enterprises operates. Through this organization, he has been working in five districts in Rural Karnataka with 22,000 women (as part of Self Helf groups).

By introducing Barefoot Solar Products to these village women, Nagendra can bring power to households that suffer from unreliable or poor grid supply. These women can also go on to earn a livelihood by distributing Barefoot products within their community.

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's Solar Products

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is married with two children. Remegia is 62 years old and lives in Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Remegia operates her own sari-sari store and has this business to earn a living. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of small business. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for additional capital.

Remegia has been an old member of PMPC. In the future, Remegia hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to display in her store

location.town: Liloy- Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es:
La Asociación el Mana está conformado por once integrantes diez mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan  por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a  trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María  tiene por actividad  económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, pan, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda  obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal El Mana esta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “El Mana” association is made up of 11 members, 10 ladies and one gentleman; responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children to care for.  They are from the northern area of the country and are known for being hardworking and responsible with a desire to personally succeed.  Unfortunately they were not able to study for careers because they needed to go to work at a young age to help with the household expenses.  Currently they are working hard to provide a better future for their children.  

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, Maria has a small store where she sells foodstuff such as rice, beans, sugar, firewood, bread, detergent, juices, and soft drinks.  She works in her business, set up in her home, for 12 hours a day.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her store and buy and sell food so that she will be able to obtain greater earnings in the near future.

The “El Mana” communal association is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Doña Rosana es madre  de 6 hijos. con sus esfuerzos ha logrado darles comida y estudios, y sacar adelante a su familia. ella solicita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (600.000) para comprar algo de ropa y poder venderla y así obtener algunas ganancias que le ayuden a seguir alimentando a su familia. con esto va a seguir triunfando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en: Rosana is the mother of six children and has managed to feed and provide them with an education, and get her family ahead through her efforts.  She is asking for a loan of 600,000 Colones to buy some clothing to resell and obtain some profit that will help her to continue feeding her family.  With this she will be able to continue succeeding as she has up to now.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ndèye Marie

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Ndèye Marie, est une fille très brave et très motivée. Elle est une étudiante en banque finance et doit écrire son mémoire, c’est la raison pour laquelle, elle sollicite un crédit au niveau de l’IMCEC. Ndèye Marie a besoin d’argent pour imprimer son mémoire, seulement, elle a décidé de ne pas se limiter à faire un crédit  à l’IMCEC, mais en plus, elle donne des cours de renforcement à des élèves du cycle primaire et moyen secondaire. Et grâce à cela, elle peut avoir une somme de soixante cinq mille francs qu’elle peut mettre de coté.
 Elle est célibataire et vit chez ses parents qui la prennent en chargent. Elle fait le ménage le matin et dispense les cours l’après-midi. 
Mlle Ndèye Marie est ambitieuse et elle désire terminer ses études à l’étranger.
texts.en:
Miss Ndèye Marie, is a very worthy and highly motivated woman. She is a student in financial banking and has to write her thesis, this is why she is requesting a loan at the IMCEC.  Ndèye Marie needs money to print her thesis. However, she has decided not to limit herself to getting a loan from IMCEC, in addition, she tutors students of primary and secondary school. This activity can provide her with 65,000 francs that she can set aside.

She is single and lives with her parents who provide for her. She does house cleaning in the morning and tutors in the afternoon.
Miss Ndèye Marie is ambitious and would like to complete her studies abroad.

loans.use: to print her thesis at the end of her financial banking studies.

loans.name: Chelsea Milena

texts.es: Chelsea Milena es una joven de 18 años que desea empezar a realizar sus estudios universitarios, pero su familia no tiene el dinero para ayudarle, es por esto que ella desea tener un crédito de ochocientos mil colones (800.000) para poder matricularse en la universidad y solucionar los pagos que esto conlleva;, y así poder seguir triunfando profesionalmente y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Chelsea Milena is a young 18 year old woman who wants to begin her university education, but her family doesn’t have the money to help her, so she is asking for a loan of 800,000 Colones so she can matriculate into the university and solve the problem or payment.  This way she can continue winning professionally and help her family financially.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca, a sus 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. Durante 20 años ha trabajado como comerciante independiente, inicialmente fue vendedora ambulante, pero contó con la suerte de que las autoridades de espacio público le adjudicaran un puesto fijo; allí trabaja todos los días de 9:00 am a 6:00 pm y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.
Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama) para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, con los que podrá seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar y además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 
Blanca manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener su negocio en un local comercial en el que pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes y así evitar los riesgos a los que se expone trabajando en la calle; además tendría la capacidad para brindar mejor bienestar, educación y condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 years old and is the single mother of three children whom she gets ahead through her arduous effort and dedication.  She has worked as an independent merchant for 20 years.  Initially she sold on foot, but she got lucky and the public authorities adjudicated her a fixed location.  She works there every day from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm and has managed to generate the income necessary to pay for the family needs.

She says that her interest in the loan is to buy merchandise in quantity (blouses, jeans, ladies’ pants) to stock up enough so she can satisfy her customers’ needs with a variety of merchandise.  This will help her improve her sales and income and will allow her to continue providing for her family’s needs.  She will also be able to face the challenges she has, which is the disloyal competition in the area.

Blanca says that her biggest desire is to have a commercial location where she can tend comfortably to her customers and avoid the risks that she is exposed to while working in the street.  She will also have the ability to provide better wellbeing, education, and living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Amani-Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Asha is single and a mother of six children who are in school. She is in her early 40s and is currently running a food business selling milk with bites like chapatti, sweet potatoes and fried cassava. She has been in this business since 1999 when it was small but now it has grown to the extent that it enables Asha to meet her family expenses easier. She operates her business from 4 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Asha's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy raw ingredients like baking flour, milk, cooking oil, sweet potatoes and other items for her business requirements. She dreams of building a house for her family. Asha will share this loan with her loan group, Amani-Hondogo, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Leoni is a single man in his early 20s. He is taking care of his young brother who is in college. For the last three years and six months, Leoni has been managing his life by running a classic barbershop providing different hair services. Leoni works from 8:30 am to 9 pm per working day.  He is really doing great and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Leoni used his previous loans to buy new hair cutting machines, a storage water tank for his business water assurance, and a hair washing machine and made aluminum cupboards for safe-keeping of his business machines. He has paid back all of his previous loans successfully. Leoni used his earned profit to pay tuition fees for his young brother, covered his own living expenses and saved a small portion for his future. He also bought a TV. Leoni will use this loan to buy a new modern barbershop machine. He dreams of running this business in his own place because renting is expensive. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, DOVE, which totals four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new modern barbershop machine.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Ani is a housewife living with five people in the family home in Bandung, a city known as "The City of Flower", located about two hours from Jakarta. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

Ani runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to improve her business. She is glad that her business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents.
 
As her business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends. For the last three months, she has had around $10-$11 per day sales just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. Ani plans to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra cash for her children's education. 

In the photo, Ani is standing in front of her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Om-Aseel Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Aseel. This group consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Marwa is its president. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 280,000 YER. Marwa is a 24-year-old married woman who has children. She currently has a business selling ladies clothes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for two years. The loan of 70,000 YER from AMB that she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital to buy ladies clothes and perfumes. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy ladies clothes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to pay the maintenance costs for his tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special raw materials that will increase his production, especially for the Christmas and New Year's Eve requests.

loans.name: Sutiava Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Sitiaba está conformada por diez integrantes mujeres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Son originarias de  la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre les gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente no pudieron  cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan, para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Karen y  tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de producto comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal Sitiaba agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Sitiaba communal association is made up of ten responsible women with 15 children to care for.  They are from the northern part of the country and are known for being responsible and hardworking people with a desire for personal success.  They like to enjoy their children’s company in their spare time.  Unfortunately they were not able to study for careers because they needed to go to work at a young age to help with the household expenses.  Currently they are working hard to provide a better future for their children.  

Thanks to her effort and a desire to get ahead, Karen has a store where she sells foodstuff such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices, and soft drinks.  She works her business for 12 hours a day and will use the money from this loan to stock her business to buy and sell foodstuff so that she can have a better income in the near future.

The Sitiaba communal association is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Nilda Teresa

texts.es:
Nilda agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo anterior y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de productos de belleza y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza en oferta para esta campaña navideña.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nilda is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the previous loan.  She is happy for the support and she is continuing with her sale of beauty products.  She needs a loan to buy beauty products on sale for the Christmas season.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: A. Olivier Ferdinand

texts.fr: A. Olivier Ferdinand âgé de 40 ans est marié à une couturière du nom de Madeleine. Le couple à quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. A. Olivier Ferdinand vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. A. Olivier Ferdinand a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau primaire mais a appris la couture par la suite. En dehors de son activité, A. Olivier Ferdinand achète de l'huile végétale qu'il revend. A. Olivier Ferdinand s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, A. Olivier Ferdinand sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
A. Olivier Ferdinand is 40 years old and married to a seamstress named Madeleine. The couple has four dependent children - some of whom go to school. A. Olivier Ferdinand lives with his wife and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. 

A. Olivier Ferdinand went to elementary school, but learned sewing afterward. Outside of his business, A. Olivier Ferdinand buys vegetable oil that he resells. A. Olivier Ferdinand buys his supplies in a city in Benin. 

With the goal of satisfying the needs of his clients, A. Olivier Ferdinand is asking ALIDé for financial support for the fourth time. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: buy clippers, sewing equipment, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Nelly María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un  hijo de dos años de edad el cual es su vida entera. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
Doña Nelly tiene una tienda de víveres  en la casa de su mama lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Ella empezó con muy poco y reunió todo el capital que tenia y empezó su negocio el mismo que día a día lo ha ido aumentando, además de víveres también vende ciertos artículos de bazar,  lleva 8 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo y estar atenta a las necesidades de su hijo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella mejora su negocio y su vida. Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” credit group meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo every two weeks.  This area is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro festivals, and for its people’s happiness.

Nelly lives here.  She is 28 years old, married, and has a two year old son.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Nelly has a grocery store set up in her mother’s home, where she lives with her husband.  She sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, etc.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She began with very little and saved the money she had, started her business, and grew it little by little.  Besides food, she also sells certain general items.  She has had her business for eight years and it allows her to earn some money and provide for her son’s needs.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her store by buying rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other products.  She has been with the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to improve her business and her life.  Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel es madre de 4 niños, ella ayuda a los pocos ingresos que tiene su esposo con el engorde del ganado para luego venderlo. Esto les ha permitido poder darle alimento y hogar a sus hijos. Actualmente la situación económica es muy difícil es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (1.035.000) para comprar ganado y hacerlo engordar, y con esto poder tener la oportunidad de seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is the mother of four children and she helps her husband with the small income she has, by fattening up livestock and then selling it.  This has allowed her to feed and house her children.

The current financial situation is difficult and it’s very hard on her, so she is asking for a loan of 1,035,000 Colones to buy livestock to fatten up.  This will provide her with the opportunity to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Sandra Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 6 años que  estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Sandra es una muy buena esposa que  realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual  es vendedor ambulante, el vende ropa interior, medias, camisetas, gorras, entre otras prendas, trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día, el recorre las calles de la ciudad vendiendo sus productos. Su esposo lleva más de 6 años con esta actividad con la cual  saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para que su esposo compre ropa interior, camisetas, pantalones y otras prendas. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque se siente útil ayudando a su marido. Su sueño es tener un local para vender la mercadería.
texts.en: El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza [New Hope Loan Group] meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people. Here lives the lady Sandra. She is 29 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has two sons, ages 6 and 13, who study in elementary school and high school. Her husband is a shopkeeper. Doña Sandra is a very good wife that takes loans for her husband who is a street vendor. He sells underwear, socks, shirts and hats, among other garments. He works every day and he passes through the city streets selling his products for almost the whole day. Her husband has worked in this business for more than 6 years, helping his family get ahead. This loan will be used for her husband's purchase of underwear, shirts, pants and other garments. Doña Sandra has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 5 years and likes it because she feels useful helping her husband. Her dream is to have an establishment in which to sell merchandise.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, pants and other garments.

loans.name: Cerbando

texts.es: El señor Cerbando tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, vive con ellos y su conyugue en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque. Se dedica a la actividad agrícola y pecuaria, contrata personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos, lo cuales tiene que llevar a vender  hasta la feria local. Como no tiene muchos recursos económicos solicita un crédito para la compra de abono y semilla para continuar trabajando y obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Cerbando  has two children who attend school.  He lives with them and his wife in a rural part of the Tiraque province.  He is a farmer and raises livestock and hires people for planting and harvesting his products, which he sells at the local fair.  Since he doesn’t have many resources, he is asking for a loan to buy compost and seeds so he can continue working and obtaining an income to cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Rosa Estefania

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, dos mayores y el menor de 6 años, dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que  realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual  es un vendedor ambulante, el vende ropa de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días  recorriendo las calles de la ciudad, su esposo lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para que su esposo compre ropa. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] Credit Group meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being a commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Rosa lives here.  She is 42 and is married, and she and her husband have three kids.  The older two are grown up and the youngest is six.  Two of Rosa's kids live with her, and they are in college and elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.  Rosa is a very good wife and she requests this loan for her husband's business.  He is a mobile vendor selling clothing of various kinds.  He works every day, moving around the streets of the city, and he has been in this line of work for more than 20 years.  The loan will be used for Rosa's husband to buy clothing.  She has been in the credit group for four cycles and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Gladys Alicia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 8 y 5 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Gladys con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta por el bien de su familia se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un pequeño local en la calle Chile que es una calle donde muchos comerciantes venden sus productos en la ciudad, en este pequeño puesto ella vende ropa de todo tipo, allí trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Sus productos los compra en Picoaza en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio. Lleva con su negocio por más de 10  años, negocio con el cual saca adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior y otras prendas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 3 años y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” credit group meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo every two weeks.  This area is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro festivals, and for its people’s happiness.

Gladys lives here.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, ages 13, 11, 8, and 5.  They all attend high school and school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Gladys is a merchant so that she could earn some money for her family’s wellbeing.  She has a small shop on Chile Street, which is a street where merchants in town sell their products.  She sells all types of clothing from this small shop and works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  She buys her products from a distributor in Picoaza for good prices and has been in business for 10 years.  This business allows her to get her children ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, undergarments, and other articles of clothing.  She has been with the credit group for three years and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans.  Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en: Athanasie is 36 years old. She is married with four children. She runs a hardware store and has spent eight years in the business. With the loan, she plans to buy more cement, nails and many more construction materials for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cement, nails and many more construction materials for sale.

loans.name: Le Tresor (2) Group

texts.en:
Cornelie is one of the members of the group Le Tresor. She is the leader of a group consisting of eleven other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Cornelie is married with two children who go to school; she is in her fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo. 

She will use her loan to purchase chairs, a stock of drinks and storage crates which she will then use for her restaurant where she sells manioc and beverages for her clients. 

Cornelie treats her clients with a high level of customer service to keep them coming back. Her goal is to expand her activities with HOPE Congo in the future, and hopes to one day to save enough to send her son abroad to travel outside of Congo.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, a stock of drinks and storage crates for the restaurant

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 39 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a una pequeña ferretería. Inicio en este negocio con el apoyo de su esposo, el cual le ayudo a inaugurar un pequeño local de ferretería. Actualmente este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante y generarle ingresos a su familia. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar artículos como: pegamentos, desarmadores, tornillos, clavos, martillos entre otros, con el fin de aumentar su inventario. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá su negocio y las ventas, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es extender su negocio.
texts.en: Elsa is from Esteli.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She is 39 years old and a merchant who has a small hardware store.  She started this business with help from her husband and he helped her open the store.  This business has allowed her to get ahead and generate income for her family.  Her next goal is to improve the conditions in the business and she is asking for a loan to buy glue, screwdrivers, screws, nails, hammers, and other things so she can increase her inventory.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help in growing her business and increasing her sales and income.  Her future plans are to grow the business.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria tiene 37 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería general(zapatos). Negocio que inicio vendiendo pocas mercaderías de otras personas. Pero, poco a poco fue  comprando su propia mercadería. Y ahora cuenta con su propia clientela y su propio negocio. Su meta próxima es comprar zapatos por mayor. Solicita el crédito para comprar todo tipo de zapatos: botas, zapatos escolares, sandalias, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar mercadería nueva y diferente. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá diversificar sus productos y crecer aún más su negocio. Su plan futuro es dar a conocer más sus productos en otras zonas de la ciudad.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She is from Esteli and is a merchant who sells general merchandise (shoes).  She started by selling a small amount of items for other people.  Little by little she started buying her own merchandise and now has her own customers and her own business.  Her next goal is to buy shoes in quantity.  She is asking for a loan to buy all types of shoes: boots, school shoes, sandals, and other things so she can offer new and different merchandise.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help to her because she will be able to diversify her products and grow her business.  Her plans for the future are to advertise her products in other parts of the city.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader es Originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa, el cual ha logrado con mucho empeño. Esta agradecido con kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo comprar una variedad de mercadería y poder abastecer a su clientela.  Solicita el crédito para comprar ropa usada en pacas y al por mayor, con el fin de ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos y de calidad. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá salir adelante con sus metas y tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Jader is from Esteli and is a merchant who sells clothing.  He has put lots of effort into it and is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because he was able to buy a variety of merchandise and supply his customers.  He is asking for a loan to buy packs of used clothing in quantity so he can offer his customers a variety of products and qualities.  He estimates that this loan will be helpful and he will be able to get ahead with his goals and have a home of his own.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Simon Merveille

texts.fr: Simon est un jeune garçon âgé de 22 ans célibataire et sans enfants, il est fermier et fait également l'élevage de porcs depuis 06 ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale. Son activité se déroule dans les bonnes conditions mais Simon désire agrandir son activité en achetant encore plus de porcs et de poules ainsi que de la provende pour leur nutrition. C'est pour réaliser ses ambitions qu'il s'est tourné vers nous pour solliciter un financement. Avec ce crédit, Simon utilisera une partie pour améliorer son élevage, agrandir ses locaux et renforcer sa position dans le quartier et sur le marché en cette période de fêtes de fin d'années et l'autre partie lui permettra de prendre soin de ses petits frères.
texts.en:
Simon is a 22-year-old single young man, he has no children. He is a farmer and has also been raising pigs in a district of the capital for 6 years. His activity is doing well but Simon wants to expand his business by buying even more pigs and chickens, as well as provender for their nutrition. 

To realize his goal he turned to us to request a loan. Simon will use this loan in part to improve his farming, expand his premises and strengthen his position in the area and at the market during this holiday season. The other part will allow him to provide for his little brothers.

loans.use: Acheter la provende pour porcs et poules

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura, a sus 57 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició hace varios como una alternativa para generar recursos económicos para sostener a su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos; el negocio lo abre todos los días y, además de ofrecer los productos de la canasta familiar, también alterna con la venta de almuerzos, comidas rápidas y fritos como buñuelos; cuenta con el apoyo de una persona que contrata esporádicamente, dependiendo del volumen de trabajo.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con surtido e insumos (lácteos, carnes frías, huevos, granos, gaseosas, aceite, entre otros); así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en esta temporada de navidad; mejorando los ingresos para su familia.
Rosaura tiene como proyecto principal, seguir acreditando su negocio y darle permanencia en el tiempo, para que siga siendo la fuente de ingresos primordial para sus hijos, con lo que se podrán forjar un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 57 years old and has her own business, a grocery store that she opened as an alternate way to generate income to support her family, made up of her husband and three children.  She opens her store every day and offers family food products.  She also sells lunches, fast food, and fried food like buñuelos and she gets sporadic help from another person depending on her workload.

She is asking for a loan to stock her store (dairy, cold cuts, eggs, grains, soft drinks, cooking oil, and other things).  This way she will be in a position to satisfy her customer demand over this Christmas season, and be able to improve her family income.

Rosaura’s main plan is to continue accrediting her business and make it more permanent over time, so she can continue being a source of income for her children, allowing them to forge a more prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives and works close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Elias is married and has five children. His wife works as a shopkeeper, while Elias farms their land. He has been farming for 16 years, and is currently growing maize, beans, and sunflower. He is excited to start beekeeping because “I will get pollination in my farm to increase yield and quality of crop.”

Elias is thankful for Kiva lenders, as they have enabled him to get hives through flexible payment terms. This is Elias’ first Kiva loan, and he plans to use the income “for the purposes of school fees. I am creating an education fund for my children in beehives.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Faraja Mavurunza Group

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman in her mid-thirties and has a son. She also takes care of two relative's children; both of them are in school. 

For four years, she has been running a business selling Muslim style dresses and other dresses made of different fabrics. Nuru also owns another new one-year-old business selling charcoal.  She works at her businesses from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a new charcoal business and bought new dresses for her business. Nuru has managed to successfully pay back all of her previous loans.  

With her business profits, she pays for part of the school fees and household expenses. She also built a house with electricity and bought household items like a cupboard and a television.

Nuru will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal and clothes for her business to resell.  She dreams to improve both businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Faraja which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and clothes for her business to resell.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Regina is in her mid-30s, is married, and has a child who is in school. She has been managing a grocery business selling soft drinks, beer, spirits, and wine. She has been in this business for three years now. Regina works from 11am to 10pm every working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy crates of beer and sodas and a television and radio to attract more customers. Regina really tries to make her business look attractive. 

She has managed to successfully pay back all of her previous loans. With her business profits, she paid for school fees, household food, and health expenses. 

Regina will use the new loan to buy drinks for her business such as soft drinks, beer, and wine. She dreams to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Sisi kwa Sisi which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her business such as soft drinks, beer, and wine.

loans.name: Annex Group

texts.en:
Eva is a single woman taking care of her three school-aged sons. She is in her late forties and currently has been managing a cafe. 

Eva has been in this venture for five years now. Her business is open from 9am to 10pm every working day, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Eva’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy soft drinks and raw food ingredients like baking flour, cooking oil, and meat. 

Eva dreams to buy a motorbike for business and to buy cows for resale. 

Eva will share this loan with her loan group Annex which has five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and raw food ingredients like baking flour, cooking oil, and meat

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: Martha de 42 años es casada con 02 hijos 01 de ellos en etapa escolar, ella  pertenece al grupo  “Estrellas De Fátima” conformada por 09 mujeres emprendedoras. Con los deseos de mejorar Martha inicia su propio negocio, donde actualmente  ofrece menú la cual lo realiza a reparto. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos y bebidas. El deseo de Martha es de ver a sus hijos  realizados profesionalmente.  El grupo “Estrellas De Fátima” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Martha se encuentra de pie  en la parte posterior y viste polo color rojo.
texts.en: Martha is 42 years old and married with two children, one of which is in school. She belongs to the group "Estrellas De Fátima” ["Stars of Fátima"], which is made up of 9 women entrepreneurs. With the desire to improve, Martha is starting her own business, where she currently offers meals for delivery. It is for this that she requested the loan to purchase rice, sugar, noodles and drinks. Martha's wish is to see her children succeed professionally. The group "Estrellas De Fátima” thanks Kiva lenders for the help they have given. Martha can be found standing in the back of the photo, wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles and drinks.

loans.name: Ehouédé Émilienne

texts.fr: Ehouédé Émilienne âgé de 24 ans est mariée à un juriste, nommé Sylvestre. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ehouédé Émilienne vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Ehouédé Émilienne et son mari. Ehouédé Émilienne a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ehouédé Émilienne vend du poisson, de l'huile végétale et divers articles dans sa région depuis vingt-ans. Ehouédé Émilienne s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Ehouédé Émilienne sollicite pour la septième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Ehouédé Émilienne, aged 24, is  married to a legal expert named Sylvestre. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Ehouédé Émilienne lives alone with her children. The diverse household expenses are covered by her and her husband. Ehouédé Émilienne has a middle school education. To meet family needs, she has been selling fish, vegetable oil, and various goods in her region for twenty years. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. With the goal of satisfying customer demands, Ehouédé Émilienne is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the seventh time. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fish, vegetable oil, and various goods to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Irene is married, and has six children. Both she and her husband have been farming for 23 years, and are currently using their land to rear livestock and tend to tree plantations. Irene likes beekeeping because it is a “source of sustainable income from trees in the area.”

This is Irene’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to expand tree plantations on her land.

loans.use: To buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Gie Takku Liggey Dialègne 10 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Takku Liggey Dialègne 10 avec comme responsable la dame Catherine, regroupe quatre femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce de produits alimentaires et cela depuis des années. Elles sont toute mariées et ont des enfants. Elles gèrent leur foyer en prenant des revenus de leur activité pour s’occuper, soit de la nourriture, soit de la scolarisation des enfants ou même du payement des factures. Elles ne restent donc pas passives face à la conjoncture actuelle difficile. 

Catherine, la présidente, vend de l’huile de palme et du citron liquide, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 5 ans maintenant.
