Elle part chercher le produit dans son village natal pour venir le revendre dans le quartier où elle habite et où elle compte une clientèle assez forte grâce à la qualité de ce qu’elle vend. Elle aide son mari dans les charges de la maison.

Et comme les autres membres de son groupe elle a comme projet de diversifier son activité et avoir plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey Dialègne 10 group, which is led by Catherine, has four female members who have worked selling food products for years. They are all married and have children, and provide for their households using the income from their businesses, paying for food, their children's education and the household bills. In other words, they are active when it comes to facing up to today's difficult conditions.

Catherine, the group's president, sells palm oil and lemon juice, an activity she has engaged in for 5 years now. She leaves to get the product in her native village to come and sell in the neighborhood where she lives and where she has many customers familiar with the quality of what she sells. She helps her husband provide for the household.

And like other members of this group, she is trying to diversify her business and have more benefits.

loans.use: to buy varied food products: vegetables, palm oil, lemon juice, etc.

loans.name: Turikumwe Cb Group

texts.en: Turikumwe CB means "we’re together" in English and is led by Valencie, who is 40 years old. She is married with seven children. Valencie leads the group and they have spent ten years in the business. Personally, she sells shoes and her fellow group members sell different merchandise. All group members have the same driven purpose of becoming great business men and women in the future. With the loan, Valencie wants to add more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jesoudonan 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESOUDONAN 1 est composé de vingt-un personnes qui sont des amies et qui font presque les mêmes activités. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Pascaline est âgée de 32 ans. Pascaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Pascaline est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que Pascaline vend divers articles par la technique de distribution dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Pascaline achète des noix de palme qu'elle transforme en huile végétale, qu'elle revend par la suite. Pascaline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Pascaline ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESOUDONAN 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The JESOUDONAN 1 group is made up of 21 women who are friends and mostly work in the same field. The group leader is called Pascaline and is 32 years old; she never attended school. In order to boost their activity levels and to better meet their customers' demands, this group is seeking its first loan from ALIDé. Pascaline is married to a welder called Jean. The couple has five children, some of whom attend school. Pascaline lives with her husband and children. The couple works together to see to the family's needs. It is for this reason that Pascaline sells various products to customers in her area. As a secondary concern, Pascaline sells palm nuts which she transforms into vegetable oil for re-sale. She sources her goods from a market in Benin. In order to boost her business activities and to see to her customers' needs, Pascaline and the other members of JESOUDONAN 1 are seeking their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.fr: Bertrand est un homme de 35 ans, célibataire et père de 3 enfants dont deux vont à l'école. il possède et gère une boutique où il vend des produits alimentaires (pain, œuf, lait, sucre, etc) dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits alimentaires à hauteur de 300 000 francs afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et renforcer son son activité. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité d'un part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, location, nutrition) d'autre part.
texts.en: Bertrand is a 35-year-old man, who is single and a father to three children, two of whom are at school. He owns and runs a store in a neighborhood of his city, where has sold food products (bread, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.) for the past seven years. He has requested a loan to buy more stock of food products (300,000 francs), which will allow him to increase his turnover and consolidate his business. Bertrand will use the profits he makes to reinvest in his business and provide for his family's education, housing and food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.en:
Zakhir is married, and he is 35 years old. Zakhir recently married and today his wife is pregnant. They live in the Abseron region, but his family is an IDP(Internally Displaced Persons) from Kalbajar city. 

Zakhir is a painter. He wants to give a better future to his soon-to-be-born child, so he wants to increase his business. 

For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). İt's his second loan. With this loan he wants to buy construction materials, like different paints, paint brushes, etc.. 

He thankful to Kiva and the lenders for the aid. 

Zakhir wants to hire an assistant in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Bertha Nubia

texts.es:
Bertha Nubia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijas las cuales le han costado solo a ella ya que nunca ha tenido el apoyo del padre de ellas.
Se siente muy orgullosa de ser Sauceña y madre soltera porque es algo que la caracteriza como una mujer valiente y luchadora que por el amor a sus hijas ha trabajado muy fuerte para sacarlas a delante.
Labora como Gestor de cobro de impuestos donde a diario recorre los negocios de dicho municipio en una bicicleta para agilizar su trabajo y sentir menos la presión del sol.
Bertha Nubia se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva para los gastos de promoción de su hija menor que sale de primaria, ya que su salario no alcanza para cubrir estos gastos porque es muy bajo.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud porque es una de las tantas personas de escasos recursos de Nicaragua que necesitan de una mano amiga.
texts.en: Bertha Nubia is a native of the city of El Sauce. She is a single mother of two daughters which have been supported by only her since she has never had the support of the girls' father. She is very proud to be Sauceña and a single mother because it is something that characterizes her as a brave woman and a fighter. For love of her daughters she has worked very hard to help them get ahead. She works as a consultant for a tax collector. She travels daily to the business of a determined city by bicycle in order to speed up her work and lessen the sun's pressure. Bertha Nubia presented herself at the Ceprodel office in search of financing from the funds of Kiva lenders for the expenses of the advancement of her younger daughter who is continuing on from primary school. Her salary is not sufficient to cover these expenses because it is very low. She hopes and trusts in God that these good-hearted people will support her loan because she is one of the many people in Nicaragua with scarce resources that needs a helping hand.

loans.use: Gastos de promoción de primaria

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a young and purposeful woman. She was born in 1995. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’, through a women's organization and organized her own business sewing national dresses. Nowadays, she has her own workshop, which she manages successfully. She has some students who she teaches how to sew national dresses. Zarina’s mother helps her with her business. Zarina is going to be married, but she does not have money to organize her wedding party. Zarina is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to throw a wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To throw a wedding party for herself

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of hair relaxer, hair extensions and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha, age 50, is a maize farmer and a beekeeper. He also works for a local private company as a driver, and his salary generates approximately 250-300 Gel per month. He owns 0.4 hectares of farmland, where he grows his crops and keeps his single bee-hive. He is a very hard-working man who takes good care of the colony of bees in his bee-hive and cultivates his land seasonally. He is unmarried and lives in the Kvareli district of the Kakheti region.

Because he has gained good experience as a driver, Vazha wishes to start his own taxi business. After several unsuccessful attempts to obtain start-up credit, Vazha applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the organization's start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva serving poor rural entrepreneurs who hope to start or re-start businesses. 

This loan of $2,500 will allow Vazha to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them to and from nearby cities. This credit will be a great support for him as he starts his new business.

Vazha is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand car to start his new taxi business

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele is 25 years old. She sells used shoes and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used in making savings.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Nancy, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su marido trabaja en el extranjero.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos poder darle a su hijo las cosas que él necesita, para esto ella se dedica a la venta ropa de todos tipo así como también productos de Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja cuatro días más que todo en las horas de la mañana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y cobra semanalmente, los productos que más vende son los perfumes y los maquillajes.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y maquillajes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 años y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápido sin tantos trámites. Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] Credit Group meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being a commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people. Nancy lives here.  She is 35 and is married, and she and her husband have a 15-year-old son who is in secondary school.  Her husband works abroad.  Nancy is a woman who likes to fend for herself and to have the income to provide her son with the things he needs.  This is why she sells clothing of all kinds as well as Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She works four days a week, mostly in the mornings.  She sells door to door and she gets her money once a week.  The products she sells most are perfume and makeup.  This loan is for clothing, perfume, lotion, and makeup.  Nancy has been in the credit group for six years and she likes it because she can get loans quickly without as much paperwork.  Her dream is to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, lotion, and makeup

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo está en el 4to. año de la carrera de Bioquímica Clínica, y comenta que sus metas para el futuro son no solo quedarse como Bioquímico sino también poder tener su propio comercio y así poder crecer más y más.
Es una persona muy visionaria que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por eso que está estudiando, para ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando por su objetivo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Rodrigo is in his fourth year of college studying clinical biochemistry.  He says his goals for the future are not just to be a biochemist but also to have his own business so he can grow more and more.  He is a very visionary person who wants to make something of himself.  This is why he is in school, to make something of himself.  He requests this loan to use to pay his tuition, which will allow him to keep working toward his goal.  He is thankful that he has this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is an experienced farmer from the village of Basen in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her son and two daughters. Her son has migrated to Russia as a migrant laborer. He works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. With the help of her family members Gayane is extensively engaged in agribusiness. She is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of sheep and pigs, and in cultivation of wheat and potato. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family’s income. To sustain her agribusiness, Gayane needs to make some investments in it. A loan of 2,500 USD will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family and will enable her to purchase barley seeds, to buy some forage for cattle, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for the harvesting services. Gayane and her family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds, to buy forage for cattle, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 23 años, es estudiante de la Carrera de Contador Público, está cursando el último año de la carrera, vive con sus padres en Benjamín Aceval, CHACO, además se dedica a la Venta de Joyas de plata, negocio que le permite tener los ingresos para cubrir una parte de sus estudios.
Tiene 2 hermanas una mayor y otra menor. Sale todos los días a buscar clientes y por las tardes viaja en colectivo a Asuncion para ir a la  Facultad. Sabe que su esfuerzo le ayudó a llegar donde está, por ello solicita el crédito para pagar exámenes, su colación y gastos de titulación y dedicarse a la profesión que escogió para su vida.
texts.en: Silvia, 23, is a public accounting student in her last year of college.  She lives with her parents in Benjamín Aceval, CHACO.  She also sells silver jewelry, which provides her with enough income to cover some of the costs of her education.  She has two sisters, one older and one younger.  Every day she goes out to find customers, and in the afternoons she takes a bus to Asuncion to go to campus.  Silvia knows her hard work has helped her to get where she is.  She requests this loan to pay for exams and graduation costs so she can dedicate herself to her chosen profession.

loans.use: to pay for exams and graduation costs

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон родился в 1984 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Олимчон имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Олимчон вместе со своей семьёй живет в отдаленном регионе. Олимчон уже более чем один год занимается предоставлением услуги мастера по ремонту дома. Он научился ремонтировать дом у опытного мастера. Олимчон хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Olimjon was born in 1984.  He is married and raising 2 children.  Olimjon has 2 adolescent children.  Olimjon and his family live in a distant district.  Olimjon has been providing housing repair services for over a year.  He learned to repair houses from an experienced repairman.  Olimjon wants to repair his house but does not have enough money to buy construction materials.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, paint, etc.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and paint, to repair his house

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia comenta que su meta es seguir estudiando, para poder tener un nivel de vida mejor, poder recibirse y ser abogada y luego de recibirse seguir estudiando para progresar y ser alguien para ella y su familia.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que se está esforzando al máximo poder sobresalir y cumplir con los objetivos que se propone.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, que le permitirá seguir estudiando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Cinthia says her goal is to continue her education so she can lead a better lifestyle, graduate and become a lawyer.  After graduation she wants to continue studying to prosper and become someone important for her family.

She is a hard worker who is doing her best to get ahead and meet the goals she sets for herself.  Cinthia is requesting a loan to cover university costs so she can continue studying and growing.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
Hermogina is 61 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

Hermogina has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for four years and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Sreema Shg Group

texts.en:
Sudhansubala is part of the "Sreema SHG" self help group. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Sudhansubala. The group is located in the Khurda district of Odisha, India. Sudhansubala is 36 years old and married. In addition to her daily activities, she alternates her time by working in agriculture. She grows grains such as wheat, barley and others. She has worked in agriculture for a long time, and the business has gone well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells her crops to the customers that request them. She is a personable and earnest person, which has allowed her to get her family ahead. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her wheat cultivation. The other members of the group work at selling crafts, selling bread, selling furniture, selling meat and running stores. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her wheat cultivation.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband wants to establish a small general store at the corner of his house. He has had a spare shop for many years and wants to establish this shop as a general store. However, due to lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy an initial stock of inventories. 

Zareena has requested a loan for her husband’s newly established general store. Now, he can easily buy stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC

loans.use: To buy an initial stock of inventories for her newly opened general store.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of two children. Her husband provides white wash services to the common people. Sometimes he has to go out of the city.  Her husband sits in the front of the paint shop to easily find new customers for his white wash services.

Her husband has a new contract for white wash but he does not have equipment and tools to provide the services. Sumaira has requested a loan so her husband is able to buy new paintbrushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.

Her husband’s income is very small, which is the reason her family is passing their lives in miserable conditions. She wants to change the current condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy equipment and tools for providing white wash services.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio es alumno del 5° semestre de la carrera Análisis de Sistemas y desde hace 1 año está trabajando en una empresa privada. Comenta que pasa sacrificios día a día, así como toda persona luchadora, que persigue sus ideales. Sus hermanos y padres lo ayudan mucho, motivándole a que no desista, pues en muchas ocasiones cuesta sobrellevar ambas actividades juntas.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad y así seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Herminio is in his fifth semester studying toward a Systems Analysis degree and he has been working for a private company for a year.  He says he must make sacrifices every day, like everyone struggling to get ahead, to meet his goals.  His siblings and parents help him a lot and motivate him so he does not get discouraged; because sometimes he feels overloaded with both activities together.

He is requesting a loan to cover university costs so he can continue striving toward his goal.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Roselida

texts.en:
Roselida is 38-year-old lady from Kakamega county married to Kanuti, who is a business man. They have five grown children. 

Roselinda sells charcoal, a business she has done for the past 20 years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya in the amount of KES 10,000, which she wants to use to buy more sacks of charcoal. 

She will use her profits to open a store which sells charcoal. Her dream is to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 29 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a restaurant. It is his only source of income and a profitable business, but Ammar needs more support to cover his family's needs. He is a hardworking man who works 15 hours a day. He is looking to increase the range of products he offers to his customers so that it becomes more pleasant for them to eat and drink in his restaurant.

He has applied for a second loan of 200,000 YER to help him to cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business. In the future, he plans to expand his business and offer better services for his clients so that he can improve his living conditions. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is the age of 35 and lives with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk and yogurt from a shop to the common people. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market for the customers.

Due to the quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in bulk. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in a large quantity. Therefore, Salma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband is able to buy more milk to sell. 

Salma is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savons, de l’habillement, des tubercules, de l’arachide, du poisson, des céréales, etc.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Sanata  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est vendeuse d’arachide. Elle compte acheter deux sacs ces deux sacs d’arachide seront décortiqués puis vendus à une clientèle composé de femmes à Wacoro. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10000 FCFA qui sera en partie utilisé l’activité et aider le conjoint à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is exclusively composed of married women. On average they are 44 years old with five children and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Djekonobougou that is in the commune of Wacoro, in the Dioila prefecture of the Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through family, neighbourhood and friendship. They sell condiments, soap, clothing, tubers, groundnuts, fish, cereals, etc.
This is the third solidarity loan for the women of the Benkadi group and will be used to buy the various products listed above.
Sanata who is the second from the right, sells groundnuts. She plans to buy two sacks of nuts which she will shell and then sell to her female customers in Wacoro. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 10000 FCFA which she will use partly for her business and the remainder to help her husband to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Bougoula, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, des condiments, de grains de dah et de  l’habillement.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente KONIBA, la deuxième personne à partir de gauche est vendeuse des grains de dah. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, deux sacs de grains de dah avec les vendeurs. Elle revend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice 8.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera réinvesti dans l’activité. 
Elle ambitionne diversifier sa marchandise dans un bref délai en y ajoutant d’autres types de condiments.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Fala Bougoula, Massigui commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro  region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the group know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell cereals, condiments, grains dah and clothing for a living. They are on their 22nd group loan.

Koniba, the person standing second from the left, sells bissap grains. With her loan, she plans to buy two bags of bissap grains from merchants. She resells these grains at retail for cash and credit to mostly female customers.

Koniba hopes to earn a monthly income of 8,000 francs CFA. These earnings will be reinvested in her business. She also aims to diversify her goods in the short term by selling other types of condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne lives in a small town outside of Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes this town a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Joselyne is married and has four children. Both her and her husband are farmers, and are currently growing maize, beans and sunflowers on their land. She likes beekeeping because it is a business that requires little work, but still produces rewards. 

This is Joselyne's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to expand beekeeping on her farm. Her hope for the future is to successfully educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Yango est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Muijiza », junior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 23 ans et nouvellement marié. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises à domicile sur l’avenue dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a seulement 8mois, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 pièces de pagnes. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant, ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Yango is a merchant and a member of the "Muijiza" business association. She is a dynamic junior entrepreneur, 23 years old and newly married.

The member sell clothes (pagnes). She displays her goods at home on the avenue in a busy area. She started her business with funds received from her husband. Her husband, too, is a businessman.

Later she was granted a loan from the Hekima MFI. She has only been in business for the past eight months. This new loan will serve to buy five lengths of pagnes. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land, educate, clothe and feed her children.

In summary, she greatly thanks Hekima for the empowerment of non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy five lengths of pagne (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Universo Group

texts.es:
Bayola: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, de los cuales solamente los dos adolescentes estudian, porque los jovencitos de 18 y 16 años trabajan en el mercado con el propósito de obtener sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su mamá. Desde hace un año en el mercado San Jerónimo de la Ciudad de Bilwi, alquila un local, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 400, en el cual vende frito (Tajadas de plátano fritas con pollo frito y ensalada de repollo con tomate), también tiene una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su tercer financiamiento en PANA PANA, con el propósito de comprar mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es construir su casa de cemento en su comunidad y regresar a su comunidad de origen Ahuyapihni, nombre en lengua miskita que significa Arena blanca, porque ahí se está iniciando el trabajo de minería y ella puede continuar su negocio con perspectivas de crecimiento.


Elvira: Desde hace 10 años vende mariscos que compra de los pescadores y buzos . 
Sus productos los maneja en termos con hielo y los vende de manera ambulante. Con el préstamo anterior brindado por PANA PANA y financiado con fondos KIVA, le permitió diversificar su negocio con otros productos: Yuca y quequisque. Ahora solicita financiamiento para comprar más pescado, camarón, caracol, langosta y continuar innovando en su negocio al vender nuevos productos como coco, banano, filipitas y plátanos. Su sueño es tener la capacidad económica para mejorar su vivienda, construirla de cemento.

Nidia: Tiene una pulpería y venta de ropas y calzados en el mercado San Jerónimo en Bilwi. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más productos para su pulpería y seguir creciendo. Con el préstamo anterior que PANA PANA le financió con fondos KIVA le permitió comprar granos básicos (arroz, harina, frijoles, azúcar)  y una caja de leche en polvo para su pequeño negocio. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa nueva para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Bayola, 39, is from Puerto Cabezas.  She is a single mother of four children, two of which still attend school.  The other two, ages 18 and 16, work at the market to earn an income and support their mother.  For a year now, Bayola has been renting a stand in the San Jerónimo Market in the city of Bilwi, where she pays C$ 400 a month rent.  There she sells fried foods (banana fritters and fried chicken and cabbage and tomato salad).  She also has a small grocery store.  She is requesting her third loan through PANA PANA in order to buy merchandise for her business.  Her goal is to build a cement house in her community and return to the community she is originally from: Ahuyapuihni.  The name in the Miskita language means white sand because mining work is starting there and she will be able to continue her business with a growth perspective.

Elvira has been in business for ten years selling seafood that she buys from fishermen and deep-sea divers.  She handles her products using iced coolers and works as a street vendor.  With her previous loan through PANA PANA with KIVA funds she was able to diversify into other products: yucca plant and coco yam.  She is now requesting a loan to buy fish, shrimp, snails and lobster and to continue innovating in her business to sell products such as coconuts and bananas.  Her goal is to have enough economic capacity to build a cement house.

Nidia has a grocery store and sells clothing and shoes in the San Jerónimo Market in Bilwi.  She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her store to continue growing.  With her previous loan through PANA PANA with KIVA funds, she was able to buy basic grains (rice, flour, beans, sugar) and a case of powdered milk for her small business.  Her dream is to have a clothing store with new items for children and adults.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Kenia Mariela

texts.es: Kenia es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora de 24 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones para mujer, pantalones para hombre, blusas, talladores, trajes de niños, bóxer, bikinis, brasieres, perfumes, cremas, lociones, bodys, maquillaje.
texts.en: Kenia, 24, is married.  She is a hard-working, determined person who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for two years.  The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise such as women's and men's pants, blouses, body shapers, children's suits, boxders, bikinis, bras, perfumes, creams, lotions and make-up.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Diandra Danikza

texts.es:
Diandra, con 28 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una pequeña repostería que se encuentra ubicada en su vivienda, donde ofrece tortas, cremas, cupcakes, entre otros, aprendió el oficio en un curso de capacitación que realizó y, obtuvo la experiencia trabajando como empleada en diferentes reposterías. Luego del nacimiento de su hija, hace 4 años, tomó la iniciativa de independizarse para estar al cuidado de su pequeña, adicionalmente y para complementar sus ingresos, también vende embutidos (morcilla) a algunos vecinos y amigos, así complementa los ingresos que percibe para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. 
El crédito lo solicita con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad para tortas y utensilios de cocina (moldes), así podrá mejorar la capacidad instalada de su microempresa y, además podrá incrementar su producción, dando como resultado un incremento en ventas y utilidades.
Diandra sueña con tener su negocio bien estructurado, amplio y bien acreditado para que le garantice una mejor rentabilidad y le permita ofrecer a su pequeña hija un mejor bienestar, educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diandra, 28, has her own business which is a small bakery in her house.  There she makes cakes, creams, cupcakes and other products.  She learned the skill at a training course she went to and gained experience working in different bakeries.  After her daughter was born four years ago, she took the initiative of becoming independent so she could take care of her.  Also, to earn extra income, she sells sausage (blood pudding) to friends and neighbors.  This give her more income to support her husband with household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a larger oven to bake cakes and kitchen utensils (mold).  This will give her small business more capacity so she can increase production, giving her greater sales and more profit.

Diandra's goal is to have a well-structured, economically sound business for more profitability so she can give her daughter a better lifestyle and a good education.

loans.use: To buy a larger oven to bake cakes and kitchen utensils (molds).

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, madre de 9 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Hace aproximadamente 5 años, inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en una pequeña caseta cercana a su vivienda, allí ofrece varios productos de la canasta familiar y así genera los recursos para su sustento diario. 
El crédito que solicita actualmente, desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, huevos, arepas, lácteos, entre otros) y realizar mejoras locativas (arreglar las paredes del local); esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen de su negocio y así atraer nuevos clientes para ofrecerles más variedad de artículos, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos para su familia.
Inés manifiesta que su anhelo es poder seguir trabajando arduamente y tener vida y salud para apoyar a sus hijos con la crianza de sus nietos que se han convertido en su motor principal para enfrentar los diversos desafíos que se le presentan.
texts.en:
Inés is a responsible, hard-working mother of nine children who she has raised through much effort and dedication.  Approximately five years ago she started her own grocery store in a small stall near her home.  There she sells essential goods and generates an income to cover daily expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy wholesale goods (cakes, eggs, tortillas, dairy products, etc.) and to fix up the walls of her stall.  This will improve the aspect of the business and attract new customers.  By offering a wider variety of products she will increase sales and income for the family.

Inés says she her goal is to continue working hard and staying healthy to help her children raise her grandchildren.  They have become her main motivation in overcoming the different challenges she is up against.

loans.use: To buy wholesale products (cakes, eggs, tortillas, dairy products, etc.) and fix up the walls of her stall.

loans.name: Gumyumutima Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe  Gumyumutima   et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a  40  ans et est mariée  à Nicodème, un  maçon.Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 8 à 17 ans et tous étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot,..) depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup de kg de riz et de haricot  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of the Gumyumutima group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and married to Nicodème, a mason. The couple have 5 children aged between 8 and 17, all of whom attend school.

Gloriose has been selling things like rice and beans in her shop for 6 years. This is her third loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and enable her to buy a large amount of rice and beans for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to see her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Urbano Alberto

texts.es:
Urbano tiene 28 años de edad estado civil Soltero vive solo, en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.
Urbano se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo cantón.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo familiar y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar más terrenos para sembrar.
Le gusta jugar futbol y reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Urbano, 28, is single and lives alone in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  The communal bank he belongs to is called SAN NICOLAS and is located in the community of San Nicolás in the Ventanas Canton.  The group works in agriculture of short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Urbano has been growing corn and rice for several years.  He buys his supplies from Agroquímica Karlita in Ventanas and sells his goods at the local market.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer, urea and other products to plant corn and rice.  The loan will help increase income for family use and for investment.  His dream is to buy more cropland.

He enjoys soccer and spending time with relatives.

loans.use: To buy supplies to plant rice.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es: Bladimir hombre emprendedor de 36 años de edad, acompañado, con un hijo, su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario por quintal como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, cajillas gaseosas, bolsones de meneítos, papel higiénico, fosforo, sal, shampoo, pasta de diente, productos lácteos, etc.
texts.en: Bladimir, 36, and his common-law parter have a son.  He is an entrepreneur who has been running a grocery store from home for three years.  The loan he is requesting is to buy inventory for his store such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, sodas, snacks, toilet paper, matches, salt, shampoo, toothpaste, dairy products, etc.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his store.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne  36 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU MARKA dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. NANA 2 eme femme  de la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 paires de boucle d’oreille, 10 paires de chaines en aluminium et quelques paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group have an average age of 36 and, on average, 6 children and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Marka, in the San/Segou Circle (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other via family relationships and they all buy and sell various products. The women of the Djiguiya group are on their first group loan.

Nana, the second woman on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 5 pairs of earrings, 10 pairs of aluminium chains and a few pairs of shoes. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 4 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare expenses and part of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 pairs of earrings, 10 pairs of aluminium chains and a few pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU PEULH  dans le cercle de SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.
 Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. DIOMINE  1 ère femme à  droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 paires de boucle d’oreilles, 20 paires de chaines en aluminium et 20 colliers en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group have an average age of 43 and, on average, 3 children and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Peulh, in the San Circle (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other via family relationships and they all buy and sell various products. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their first group loan.

Diomine, the woman on the far right of the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 10 pairs of earrings, 20 pairs of aluminium chains and 20 rubber necklaces. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of earrings, 20 pairs of aluminium chains and 20 rubber necklaces.

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Aimerance est une vaillante commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires « Zamiri », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 73 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants qui, 1 étudie et 3 autres sont déjà mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 45 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pomme de terre et 1 sac de farine de manioc, tomates,  25 poissons salés et les épices. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir son jeune étudiant. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant, ce moment critique post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Aimerance, the customer, is a hard-working saleswoman and a member of the Zamiri business group. An older, dynamic entrepreneur, she is 73 years old, widowed and the mother of 4 children, one of whom attends school and 3 of whom are already married. Aimerance sells food products. She displays her merchandise at home, in her front yard, where she has built up her clientèle. She started her business with funds she received from her husband (when he was alive). Later on, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 45 years. This new loan will enable her to buy a bag of potatoes, a bag of cassava flour, tomatoes, 25 dried fish and spices. She would like to build a house, and feed and educate her youngest child. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for enabling non-bankable female entrepreneurs to be self-sufficient, especially in this critical time after the war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a bag of potatoes, a bag of cassava flour, tomatoes, 25 dried fish and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Arinolta

texts.en:
Mildred is 50-year-old mother from Kakamega, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is a married to John and supports five people in her family that include her four children who are; 17, 15, 14 and 11 years old respectively.

She runs a small scale retail shop, and has been operating it for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to add more stock of shop items. She will use the anticipated profits to open another retail shop so as to give her more income to support the family. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock of salt, cooking oil and sugar to her shop.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives and works close to Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's largest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Jacob is married, and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and they are currently farming maize, beans, sunflower and rearing livestock. He likes beekeeping because it is easy to do, and enjoys the support from Honey Care for their beekeeping solutions.
This is Jacob’s first loan, and his hope for the future is “to see my children get the very best education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  49 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et restauration. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ère femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100kgs de riz, 2 sacs d’oignons de 50Kgs et 50 Kg de farine de blé, 15 litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group have an average age of 49 and, on average, 7 children and all live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and they buy and sell condiments and prepared food. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their 15th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous ones.

Kadia, the first woman on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of rice, 2 50-kilo bags of onions, a 50-kilo bag of wheat flour and 15 litres of oil. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to prepare meals.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne  26 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I dans La ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1 ère femme debout  à gauche   sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 rouleau de tissus léger et 8 paires de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group have an average age of 26 and, on average, 2 children and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro I, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Balimaya group are on their first group loan.

Bintou, the first woman on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 1 roll of light fabric and 8 pairs of plastic shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 19 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 roll of light fabric and 8 pairs of plastic shoes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  37 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. SITAN  1ère femme à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 pagnes wax, 20 paires collier en caoutchouc, 20 poupées et 20 jeux d’enfant.. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group are around thirty-seven years old and have an average of six children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Santoro I, in the town of San (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family and neighbourhood ties, and they work buying and selling various products.

This will be the group's sixth group loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Sitan (on the right of the photo) will use her loan to buy 10 wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing), 20 rubber necklaces, 20 dolls and 20 children's toys.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells locally, to a mixed clientele  on a cash or credit basis.

Sitan expects to earn a monthly average of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for health costs, food, clothes, rent, school fees, and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU PEULH  dans le cercle de SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. ROKIA 3 eme femme debout à gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 paniers de banane et 3 paniers de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma Group are all around thirty-four years old and have an average of five children each.  They live in traditional, extended families in Dieou Peulh which is in the San region (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and all work buying and selling various items.  

This will be the first group loan for these women.

Rokia (standing third from the left in the photo) will use her loan to buy 5 baskets of bananas and 3 baskets of papayas.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells to a mixed customer base, on a cash or credit basis.

Rokia expects to earn a monthly average of 6,000 francs CFA, which she will use for health costs, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Estrella Resplandeciente Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias trabajadoras microempresarias una de ellas es María Elena tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, con tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace 17 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años, El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones de hombre, pantalones de mujer, blusas, camisas, faldas, juego de sabanas. Marisela de 36 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida en la zona franca, Teresa de 62 años  vende cosméticos de Avon y se dedica a la costura, Martha de 57 años su negocio es la costura.
texts.en: This group is made up of four hardworking micro-entrepreneur partners. One of them is María Elena, who is 57 years old and married with three children. Her business for the past 17 years has been sellling clothing. She has been a client of the institution for two years, and she is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as men's pants, women's pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, and sets of sheets. Marisela is 36 years old and has a business selling food in the tax-free zone. Teresa is 62, sells Avon cosmetics, and does sewing. Martha is 57 and her business is sewing.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new clothing such as men's pants, women's pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, sets of sheets, etc.

loans.name: Magaly  Zulema

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 24 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche  que pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Magaly se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales como las gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y compra de insumos como abonos organicos e inorganicos.

Las compras  realiza en el cantón ventanas  frecuentemente en agripag. Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos. Se enfreta desafios como las plagas y enfremedades que se le presentan en el cultivo. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a los hijos a estudiar y bailar con ellos.
texts.en:
Magaly is 24 years old. She's in a common law marriage and has three children. She lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. She's a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. 

Magaly is a farmer who grows corn and raises animals such as chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to rent the farmland and to purchase supplies such as organic and inorganic fertilizers. She makes her purchases in the canton of Ventanas, often from a company called Agripag.

Her dream is to improve production in her crops. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases which affect the crops. In her free time she likes helping her children with their studies and dancing with them.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as organic and inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian refugee, who works hard for her living. Ibtissam is working hard to develop and run a clothes and shoe shop inside the Palestinian camp she is living. Ibtissam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a focus on special winter needs. She wants to diversify her products and respond to her customers’ needs and requests. She will increase her clothes capital with newly released items for the coming Christmas and winter season. She will also start selling winter blankets and mattresses to expand her working sector.
This loan will provide her with a wide range of items that will help her in developing her business and covering her family's socioeconomic situation.
Ibtissam hopes that in the future she can expand her workplace and move to a larger one in the future. She is planning to provide her children with a better living and a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes, newly released clothing items, winter blankets and mattresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more candles, candy, biscuits, cookies, sugar, matches, etc. for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of the tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

James is married, and has two children. His wife farms their land full-time, while he divides his time between farming and acting as an assistant chief (a position in the municipal government) of a nearby sub-location. He and his wife have been farming for 10 years, and are currently growing maize, avocado, sugarcane, beans, bananas and sunflower on their land, as well as tending to a fruit orchard. The variety of crops on his farm, in particular his sunflower and fruit trees, will benefit his bee colonies, and James is looking forward to having honey of his own for home use.
This is James’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his children’s education and domestic expenses.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALI ont en moyenne  42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO  dans la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALI sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA   2ème femme  à gauche   sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 2 rouleaux de bazin, 10 paires de boucles d’oreille, une douzaine de bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group have an average age of 42 and, on average, 6 children and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro, in the town of San/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and friendships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Balimaya group are on their 7th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous loans.

Fatoumata, the second woman from the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 2 rolls of damask fabric and 10 pairs of earrings and a dozen rubber bracelets. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 rolls of damask fabric and 10 pairs of earrings and a dozen rubber bracelets.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  29 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU MARKA dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. KARIA  1 ère femme  à gauche   sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 complets de wax réal et 3 complets d’uni wax. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group average 29 years of age, 4 children, and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Marka, in San Cercle, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell various products and are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Karia is the first woman from the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 8 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), 5 "Real Wax" and 3 "Uni Wax".

She gets her supplies in San and resells, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 4'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare and food. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  24 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à HAMDALLAYE dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. KOTIMI 2ème femme à droite,  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 15 paires de chaussures en peau et 25 paires colliers en aluminium. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group have an average age of 24 and, on average, 2 children and all live in extended traditional families in Hamdallaye, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Danaya group are on their 15th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous loans.

Kotimi, the second woman from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 15 pairs of leather shoes and 25 pairs of aluminium necklaces. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of leather shoes and 25 pairs of aluminium necklaces.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne 31 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DIEOU MARKA  dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers etc.
 Les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. MINATA  2ème femme debout  à droite   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter de 2 cartons de savon,  1 carton de pommades. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group have an average age of 31 and, on average, 5 children and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Marka, in the San/Segou Circle (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Sabaly group are on their first group loan.

Minata, the woman standing second from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy two boxes of soap and one box of creams. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 6 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  dans la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe sont à leur 1èr prêt solidaire. AWA femme debout au milieu  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 marmites, 15 douzaine de tasses, 5 douzaine d’assiettes. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group are around thirty-four years of age, and have an average of three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the town of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family and friendship, and work buying and selling various products.

This will be the first group loan for the Benkadi Group.

Awa (standing in the centre of the photo) will use her loan to buy 10 cooking pots, 15 dozen cups and 5 dozen plates.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells locally to a mixed customer base, for cash or credit.

She expects to earn a monthly average of 11,000 francs CFA, which she will use for health costs, food, clothes, rent, school fees and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Rose Ernadette

texts.fr: rose est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une alimentation où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques dans un quartier de la ville depuis 6 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des boissons a hauteur de 300000 francs afin de satisfaire sa cliente et augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans l'activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose is thirty-three years old, single and has one child.  She owns and runs a food store where she has sold bottled drinks for six years.

She has requested this loan in order to build her stock of products for sale by buying 300,000 francs CFA worth of drinks.  This will help her satisfy the demands of her customers and increase her earnings.  

Rose will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 39 años de edad, felizmente casado y padre de un hijo de 10 años, por quien lucha cada día para sacarlo adelante.
Se desempeña como comerciante independiente, su negocio consiste en la venta de gafas, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante, se ubica en uno de los parques principales del centro de la ciudad pero, cuando las ventas disminuyen anda por las diferentes calles en busca de clientela. La actividad la desarrolla todos los días y tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la labor. 
Con el propósito de fortalecer su negocio y seguir generando los ingresos para su familia, encuentra apoyo en el crédito que solicita, pues con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (gafas de sol), esto le permitirá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, dando como resultado un incremento notable en las ventas y en el nivel de ingresos que recibe.
Edison manifiesta que quiere cumplir el sueño de tener un local propio en el que pueda realizar su actividad de manera más cómoda, evitando todos los riesgos y desafíos que trae consigo el trabajo en la calle, de esta forma tendrá mejor rentabilidad y podrá brindar una buena educación a su hijo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Edison, who is 39 years old, is a motivated and hard-working man. He is happily married and has a 10-year-old son. He works hard every day so he can bring him up properly. He works as an independent trader and has a business selling sunglasses as a street vendor. His pitch is located in one of the main parks in the city centre but when sales are low he walks around different streets looking for customers. He works every day and has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

In order to strengthen his business and continue earning an income for his family, he is finding support in the loan he is requesting. With the money he will buy stock (sunglasses) wholesale and this will enable him to have a better variety to offer his customers and satisfy their various tastes. As a result this will give him a significant increase in his sales and the amount of income he makes.
